Tagia is a house wife and works very hard to provide her family with everything they need.She took out a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy construction supplies for her house.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for her house

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en: Abdu is a hardworking man who sells fruits and vegetables every day. He works in Sana'a, Yemen. He is 40 years old and is the married father of nine children who now live independently. He started his business long ago on a movable wheelbarrow usually containing a tomato basket and one other basket of potatoes with small a mount then then he expanded his business and opened a vegetables and fruits store. He bought more vegetables and fruits and the profits were helpful. He uses loans so that he can buy a greater variety of vegetables and fruit. In addition, this has been helping him to cover his family expenses. He applied for a loan of YER 200,000 from Al Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB). He will use this new loan to buy vegetables and fruits so that he can continue making his sales.

loans.use: to purchase enough vegetables to meet his clientele's demand

loans.name: Jaafar

texts.en:
Jaafar is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man who is living with his wife. They have three children; one is working and two others are still attending school. He’s the one responsible for his family and looking to enhance their way of living. He has big responsibilities especially paying his children’s study fees. 

He has owned a pick up for the past 29 years. His job consists of selling products, fruits and vegetables to the neighboring villages upon request. With all these years of experience, Jaafar became expert in his field and more than this, able to respond rapidly to his clients' demands. 

Today, to increase his earnings, Jaafar is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of provisions and fruits for his business to be able to improve his sales. This will certainly boost his revenues and develop his job. In the future, he plans to hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to purchase products and fruits for his business.

loans.name: Lesly

texts.es:
Lesly tiene 31 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable. Su pareja es Jonás, de 37 años, con quien tiene dos hijos de 12 y de 3 años. Ella vive a lado de su familia, en la casa de sus suegros, es ahí donde a diario brinda lo mejor a su familia, ya que desea darles una mejor calidad de vida.

Su trabajo consiste en la venta de verduras de la región como culantro, ají dulce, yuca, tomates entre otros. Tiene un puesto en el mercado principal de la ciudad y realiza este oficio desde hace 5 años, durante las mañanas, ya que también se desempeña como secretaria en un aserradero ubicado, por las tardes, en este trabajo tiene recién un mes. Le gusta lo que hace, ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos; a veces saca un porcentaje alto de las ventas de verduras, pero algunas veces solo gana para solventar los gastos del día. Espera que en un futuro cercano pueda tener un negocio de venta de comidas en un puesto que tiene libre al costado de su puesto en el mercado.

Este es su segundo crédito con la institución MFP, por tanto espera continuar con sus objetivos y crecimiento programado. Además está muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos, como lo hizo hasta ahora en sus créditos anteriores. Y le agrada mucho pertenecer a su grupo, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy puntuales y responsables.

Con el monto solicitado, 600 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de verduras para ofrecerlas a la venta y empezará a comprar lo ingredientes necesarios y algunos utensilios para iniciar su negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Lesly, 31, is a very responsible and enterprising woman. Her partner is Jonas, 37, with whom she has 2 children, 12 and 3 years old.
She lives with her family at her in-law’s house. It’s there that she offers her family her best on a daily basis, as she wants to give them a better quality of life.

Her work consists of selling vegetables from the region like coriander, sweet chilies, manioc and tomatoes, among others. She has a stand in the principal market of the city and has been in this line of work for 5 years, working in the mornings; in the afternoons, she has been working as a secretary in a sawmill for the last month. She enjoys what she does, as it provides her with a good income. Sometimes she makes a high percentage on the vegetable sales, but other times she only makes enough to pay for daily expenditures. She hopes that in the near future she can have a food sales business in the empty stand that’s beside hers in the market. 

This is the second loan she has requested with MFP as she hopes to continue with her planned objectives and growth. Also, she’s very committed to meet her payments as she’s done up to now with her previous loan. She enjoys very much being part of her group because they’re all very punctual and responsible.

With the loan she has requested of 600 soles, she’ll buy a bigger quantity of vegetables to then put up for sale and she’ll begin to buy the necessary ingredients and a few utensils to start her new food sales business.

loans.use: buy more vegetables so she can continue selling them and also to start implementing her new food sales business.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda is from the village of Mambabanga. She is 47 years old and married to Elmer, a farmer in their village. To earn a living, Rosalinda is engaged in her sari-sari store (variety store). This couple works hard to meet the needs of their children. Rosalinda wants to expand her business. In this regard, Rosalinda is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, assorted bread, candies and condiments to sell. She dreams of fully providing for her children's needs in school as they complete their education which will be serving as the key to a bright future for them.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, assorted bread, candies and condiments to sell

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo, 32, a resident of Manila, Philippines. He is married to Sheryll, and father of two children. At this time, he is working hard to be able to send his children all the way through college. Like most Filipino parents, Rodolfo believes that a college diploma is the best inheritance parents could leave to their children.

Rodolfo operates an internet café business. There is more need now than before for services like this as customers’ demand increases. His main patrons are students who require his services for school requirements. He also has people who need to rent computers for business purposes like writing a resume or composing office documentation; as well as people who just love to surf the net and engage in social networking.  He earns a minimum of 500 PHP in profits every day.

To help him continue to operate his business, Rodolfo is requesting a loan of 50, 000 PHP. He will utilize the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed for his business. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Rodolfo dreams of being able to give his children a good and high quality education through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in his business.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 54-year-old mother who loves to sell frozen foods in her village. This is her way of gaining income for her daily living while her husband cultivates their farmland. They live in a village with their four children. Through their patience and sacrifices, they have survived poverty and educated their children. 

Marciana aims to continue to improve the business so she can earn and save more income for her family's future. She is asking for additional capital of 25,000 PHP to buy "langgonisa and toccino" to sell.  She believes that this loan will help her to improve the business and is hoping that she will be successful in the future.

loans.use: to buy "langgonisa and toccino" to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario. She previously accessed a 35,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) loan that she used to buy more quantities of products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 40,000 PHP loan to purchase raw ingredients and supplies needed in her business. Her profits from the business will definitely help to meet her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rosario dreams of being able to give both her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
This is Melanie. She previously accessed a loan of 30,000 PHP that she used to purchase quantities and varieties of frozen foods needed for her business. Her earnings were a big help towards the education of her children and for their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another loan of 50,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of frozen foods needed for her business. The more items displayed at the store the better, because more items will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and pay the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Melanie hopes to be able to expand soon, as she dreams of being able to give her children a good, high quality education through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of processed meat products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is a 24-year-old youth client who is single and lives with his family.

Ali is a hairdresser for men and has owned a barber shop since 2011.  He has sufficient experience in this field as well as a deep understanding of local customers and their needs.  He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding area.

He has applied for a $2,100 “youth loan” to renovate his shop.  He aims to develop his business and increase his profit so that he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop.

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, single, and lives with his family.

Salam has owned a shop for fast moving customer goods since 2011. He sells cosmetics, shampoos, accessories in addition to miscellaneous items. He has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. He has a good reputation and he is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan in order to pay the rent and purchase more items. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay the rent and purchase more items

loans.name: Julio

texts.es:
Julio tiene 45 años, su pareja es Ruth, con quien tiene tres hijos, Carol de 15, Shesira de 13 y Abel de 5 años. Viven en su casa propia donde hasta ahora él sigue esforzándose, pues desea brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

A diario se dirige a los aserraderos ubicados en los alrededores de la ciudad para conseguir madera de buena calidad y de los precios más bajos para ponerlos a la venta en el mismo lugar donde los compra. Tiene clientes que siempre solicitan su mercadería y cuando no tiene no duda en acudir a otro lugar para conseguir lo que le pide su cliente. Lleva en este negocio desde hace 2 años y todo le está marchando de maravilla. Cumple con esta función todos los días, por lo general en las mañanas, de lunes a viernes, mientras que los fines de semana ayuda a su cónyuge en la compra y venta de granos y productos alimenticios; para eso se va al puerto de la ciudad a partir de las 4 de la madrugada donde compra directamente a los agricultores que llegan de las chacras. Sus productos preferidos son el arroz, la yuca, el maíz porque le generan mejores ganancias. Espera seguir trabajando de esta manera y más adelante establecer un pequeño reaserradero propio.

Este es su préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por lo que está muy entusiasmado de contar nuevamente con un apoyo crediticio para seguir laborando y poner aumentar su capital de trabajo. Es consciente que para seguir creciendo necesita seguir siendo responsable como lo fue hasta ahora y está muy convencido de pagar sus cuotas a tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado, 3800 nuevos soles, comprará mayor cantidad de madera, especialmente de la que se usa en las construcción de viviendas. También comprará granos y productos alimenticios (yuca, arroz y maíz) para contribuir en el negocio que tiene junto a su pareja.
texts.en:
Julio, 45, and his partner, Ruth, have 3 children: Carol, 15, Shesira, 3 and Abel, 5. They own their house. Julio continues to work hard in order to offer his family a better quality of life.

Every day, he goes to the sawmills located outside the city to buy good quality wood at low prices and then sells it in the location he happens to be in at the time. He has clients who solicit his merchandise and if he doesn’t have it, he has no problem going elsewhere to find what his clients need. He’s been in this line of business for 2 years and it’s working out wonderfully. He works every day, generally in the mornings, from Monday to Friday, while on the weekends he helps his partner buy and sell grains and food products; to do this, he gets to the city’s port by 4am where he buys directly from farmers who come directly from their farms. His preferred products are rice, manioc and corn because they generate better income. He hopes to continue working this way and in the future establish a small sawmill of his own.

This is his 10th loan with the MFP; he’s very keen to count on this financial support again, so he can continue working and increase his business capital. He’s very aware that he has to continue being as responsible as he is now in order for his business to continue growing. He’s very committed to making his payments on time. With the loan of 3800 new soles ($1450US) he’ll buy more wood, especially the kind used in building houses. He’ll also buy grain and food products (manioc, rice and corn) to contribute to the business he has with his partner.

loans.use: buy and sell more wood and buy manioc, rice and corn for his other business.

loans.name: Pochita

texts.es:
Pochita tiene 37 años, es una mujer valiente y perseverante, trabaja mucho y se esfuerza para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus cuatro hijos de 14, 12, 9 y 8 años. Juntos viven en la casa que construyó al lado de su pareja, José de 42 años.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida, para ello ha destinado un pequeño espacio en su vivienda donde ofrece los más deliciosos platillos de la región. Vende durante las mañanas, los fines de semana, desde hace 6 meses, aunque conoce este negocio desde hace 5 años, pues anteriormente vendía de manera ambulatoria por las calles de la ciudad. En este trabajo ella se siente a gusto, ya que solo se dedica unas horas del día durante las mañanas y tiene libre el resto del tiempo para poder realizar algunas actividades en su hogar. Además tiene buenos ingresos que le permiten poder brindar mejores condiciones a sus hijos, su principal anhelo es que el local que tiene ahora en casa siga en progreso hasta que logre consolidar un restaurante que goce del prestigio y de la preferencia de la gente.

Este es su crédito número 14 con MFP y está muy contenta por el apoyo financiero que le están brindando para aumentar su capital de trabajo. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y se siente tranquila perteneciendo a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas muy responsables y solidarias.

Con el monto solicitado, 2000 nuevos soles, comprará arroz, aceite, huevos, condimentos, tubérculos, verduras y otros elementos que necesita para preparar los alimentos que vende.
texts.en:
Pochita is a courageous and persevering 37-year-old woman. She works hard and strives to achieve a better quality of life for her four children, aged 14, 12, 9, and 8 years. They live together in the house she built with her partner, 42-year-old José.

Pochita works selling food, and has dedicated a small space in her home where she serves the most delicious regional dishes. For the past six months, she has sold food in the mornings and on weekends, although she has five years of experience in the business--earlier, she traveled around the city selling food on the streets. She likes this kind of work, because she can work during the mornings and have the rest of the day free for home activities. Her income has been good, allowing her to improve conditions for her children. Her biggest dream is that eventually, her business will move from the space in her home and she will be able to build a fine restaurant that people will enjoy.

This is Pochita's 14th loan with MFP, and she is very happy with the financial support she has received to increase her working capital. She agrees again to make her payments on time, as she has done with her previous loans. She also feels comfortable belonging to the community bank, because all of the members are responsible and caring.

With a loan of 2000 nuevos soles, Pochita will buy rice, oil, eggs, condiments, tubers, vegetables, and other items needed to prepare the foods that she sells.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients and supplies needed to prepare the dishes she sells.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda is a woman who has a good nature. She has many friends and all of them love her. She always tries to do the best for her friends. Mavluda has her own business for more than 14 years. She has been busy with animal husbandry. She cares for young cattle in her house. She cares for them for 2 or 3 months and then sells to local people. In the local market she has many customers.

 In business, Mavluda is helped by her husband. They love each other and have 2 clever children.  She wants to develop her business but she can’t make it without your help. She is asking for a loan of 3000 somoni  to buy young cattle for developing her business. She is one of the best clients of 'Imon international' organization and has a good credit history.  She awaits your help and support.

loans.use: To buy young cattle

loans.name: Prince

texts.en:
Prince is a 27-year-old married man with one child, who is 9 years old.  His child attends school in town.  

Prince sells music, DVDs, and some electronics at his shop.  He has operated his business since he was 20.  His main customers are young people buying music, but also many other ages buying his other products and services.  

Prince says he is very responsible and works 7 days a week.   In the future, he hopes to be able to build a house for his family and spend more time with them.

He will use a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to improve his sound system and photo studio.  His customers must hear the products he is selling so they will hopefully come in and buy from him!

loans.use: To improve his sound system and photo studio.

loans.name: Bahry

texts.en:
Bahry is married and has three children who are between 6 and 18 years old. She always wanted to provide them with good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, Bahry decided to start new business with animal husbandry in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances.

Bahry studied at the course  'To get success' of a women's organization and learnt some skills about business. She works at school as teacher and has a small salary. If you will help her with money, she would buy four sheep. Her children will help her with her business. She will be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart. 

Bahry is asking for a loan of 2000 TJS to buy sheep for organizing a new business. She will get through, using the loan and her business will go on to be a source of income, so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support. At the photo you see from left side Bahry and from right side her trainer who gives a certificate.

loans.use: To buy sheep for organization of a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for renovations and additional materials.

loans.name: Filomina

texts.en:
Filomina is 64 years old. She lives in a small village in the Akhalkalaki District with her family: her 33-year-old son, daughter-in-law, and mother, who is a pensioner. The family runs an agricultural business; they have a plot of land where they grow potatoes. They work hard on their plot during the spring and summer seasons to reap a good harvest. They sell their harvest on the local open market.

Filomina requested a loan to expand her agricultural business. The loan will enable her to cultivate the family-owned land and sow more potato there. With the borrowed amount Filomina will purchase seeds of potatoes and fertilizers for land. After properly performed seasonal agricultural work, the family hopes to have a good harvest. After selling the harvest, the family will earn increased income, which will enable them to improve their living conditions. Filomina hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to cultivate agricultural land

loans.name: Hasan

texts.ru: Хасан житель города Истаравшан. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Хасан занимается животноводством. Он в основном занимается купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности Хасан занимается более восьми лет. Он берет кредит для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Hasan is a resident of the city of Istaravshan.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Hasan is engaged in animal husbandry.  He trades livestock and has been engaged in this business for more than 8 years.  He's taking out this loan to purchase calves and cowes.

loans.use: to purchase calves and cowes for his business.

loans.name: Luisa Marina

texts.es:
Luisa sigue trabajando como conserje, obteniendo su dinero fijo, apoyando a su esposo el cual labora de albañil, ambos se están esforzando para lograr una mejor vivienda, siendo de condiciones muy sencillas, y que por este medio del financiamiento, con Afodenic, lograron cerrar con un pequeño muro la propiedad, reparación del techo, hoy en día en mejores condiciones.
Con este nuevo préstamo, comenzara hacer paredes de concreto, para una mejor seguridad, higiene en su hogar, comprara, materiales de construcción en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro y comenzar la construcción.
texts.en: Luisa continues working as a janitor, earning her fixed wage and supporting her husband in his work as a bricklayer. Both are working hard to improve their housing, as they are living in very basic conditions, and it is through a loan with Afodenic that they were able to enclose their property with a small wall and repair the ceiling, which is now in better condition. With this new loan, they will begin to make concrete walls, for better security and home hygiene. They will buy construction materials made of rock, sand, cement and iron and start building.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as rock, sand, cement and iron to build internal walls.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 53 años, es una mujer muy buena, amable y trabajadora. Está casada con Geiner, de 55 años, con quien tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales ya tres son mayores e independientes, mientras que Grimen de 21 y Kelvin de 18 años viven aun con ellos y los apoyan en sus estudios.

En su trabajo Rosa recorrer muchos lugares de su región, pues vende productos regionales como plátano, carne de monte y otros, o realiza intercambios con algunos otros productos que considera necesarios, también lleva ropa nueva y usada desde la ciudad hacia las zonas alejadas o poblaciones aledañas. Cuando regresa de su corto viaje trae consigo todos los productos que ha obtenido para venderlos en el mercado. Realiza este trabajo por más de 10 años y le gusta, pues le permite tener tiempo disponible para otras actividades en su hogar. Siente que le va bien, pues le genera buenos ingresos económicos, además que ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes donde siempre acude para vender e intercambiar lo necesario. Espera para más adelante establecer un local donde pueda vender otro tipo de productos y así estar más tranquila trabajando cómodamente en un lugar fijo.

Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto agradece a quienes hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar con su negocio y poder cumplir sus metas. Se compromete, una vez más, a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual y responsable como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. Y está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son muy buenos y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará más ropa para ir a venderla en los pueblos alejados de la ciudad e intercambiarla por otros productos.
texts.en:
Rosa is a good, kind, and hard-working 53-year-old woman. She is married to 55-year-old Geiner, with whom she has five children. Three of her children are independent adults, and Rosa and Geiner live with and support 21-year-old Grimen and 18-year-old Kelvin, who are studying.

In her work, Rosa travels to many places in the region, selling regional produce such as plátano [plantains] and wild game, or trading for products she considers necessary. She also brings new and used clothing from the city into the adjacent towns and surrounding areas. When she returns from her short trips, she sells all the products she has obtained in the marketplace. Rosa has done this work for over 10 years and enjoys it because it allows her to have free time for home activities. She thinks her business is going well because she earns a good income and also has a good client base with whom she can always sells or trade for what she needs. Rosa hopes to move forward in her business by establishing a shop in which she can sell other kinds of products and feel more comfortable working in a fixed location.

This is Rosa's third loan with MFP, and above all, she is grateful to those who have made the financing possible to continue her business and achieve her goals. She agrees to make her loan payments on time, as she has done with her previous loans. She is very happy to belong to the community bank because all the members are very good and caring.

With a loan of 3000 nuevos soles, Rosa will buy more clothing to sell in the towns surrounding the city, and trade it for other products.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell or trade in towns surrounding the city.

loans.name: Rosana Leonor

texts.es: Rosana vive en Quevedo, tiene 34 años y está casada, su esposo es guardia de seguridad y juntos tienen 4 hijos quienes estudian en la escuela del barrio. En su domicilio tiene una tienda de víveres la cual empezó hace varios años, inicio comprando poca mercadería la cual coloco en un tablero en la parte frontal de su vivienda. Hoy en día tiene una tienda con una nevera de vitrina donde expone sus productos para la venta, es un ejemplo de cómo poco a poco se van logrando las metas. Con el crédito que solicita va a comprar arroz, azúcar, café, aceite, víveres etc., una de sus preocupaciones es que los proveedores no lleguen en dejar los productos que solicita. La meta a futuro de Rosana es poder ampliar su negocio y seguir creciendo.
texts.en: Rosana lives in Quevedo,  is 34 years old, and is married. Her husband is a security guard and together they have four children, all of whom study in the neighborhood school. Rosana has a small grocery store in their house that she started several years ago. She started with buying a little bit of merchandise that she placed on a board in the front part of her house. Today she has a store with a glass cooler where she displays her products for sale. It is an example of how, little by little, she is achieving her goals. She will use the requested loan to purchase rice, sugar, coffee, oil, and other groceries. One of her worries is when the suppliers do not arrive to deliver the products she requests. Rosana's future goal is to be able to expand her store and continue growing.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, coffee, oil, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 49 años, es una mujer amable y muy alegre. Está casada con Elvis, de 48 años, el padre de sus cinco hijos, tres ya son mayores e independientes y los otros dos hijos (de 16 y 11 años) aún viven con ellos.
Ella tiene un taller de mecánica que administra desde hace 15 años, está ubicado en su casa y ahí llegan, a diario, muchos transportistas en busca de que le solucionen los desperfectos de sus vehículos. Quien se encarga del arreglo es su pareja y ella emite las boletas y facturas, trabajan juntos y empezaron a hacerlo cuando observaron la necesidad de tener un ingreso económico estable para poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Desde entonces crecieron mucho, ya que empezaron con un taller de vulcanizado y ahora tienen su taller de mecánica. Como toda persona, Rosa tiene muchas metas aun por alcanzar, pero lo que desea por ahora es poder agrandar su taller para empezar a hacer rectificaciones a motores, ya que el pago por este servicio es mayor, para eso necesita una fuerte inversión motivo por el cual está trabajando a diario con mayor tesón.

Este es su crédito número 6 con MFP y, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad y la confianza que depositan en ella para acceder a este crédito. Por otro lado, se compromete, una vez más, a realizar el pago puntual de sus cuotas mensuales como lo hizo en los créditos anteriores que tuvo. Asimismo está muy contenta de pertenecer a su banco comunal, ya que todos sus integrantes son personas buenas, amables y muy responsables.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará repuestos y accesorios para vender en su taller, también herramientas para continuar brindando el servicio de mecánica a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 49, and a friendly, very cheerful woman. She is married to Elvis, who is 48, and the father of her five children. Three are now adults and independent, and the other two children, 16 and 11, still live with them. 

She has an auto repair shop that she has been running for 15 years. It is located in her home, and many truck drivers come there daily, looking for them to fix problems with their vehicles.

Her partner takes care of the repairs, and she issues the invoices and receipts. They work together, and began to do so when they saw the need to have a stable income to be able to offer a better quality of life to their children.

Since then, they have grown considerably, as they started with a tire repair shop and now have an auto repair shop. Like every person, Rosa has many goals still to be reached, but what she wishes for now is to be able to expand her shop. This is in order to begin to do to engine overhauls, as the payment for this service is greater. For this she needs to make a large investment, and this is why she is working every day with greater determination.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, and she is very grateful for the opportunity and for the trust they have placed in her, enabling her to access this loan.  Moreover, she promises to once again pay her monthly installments on time, as she did with the earlier loans she had. 

Likewise, she is very happy to belong to her communal bank, as all the members are good, friendly and very responsible.

With the requested amount of 3000 nuevos soles, she will buy spare parts and accessories to sell in her shop, as well as tools, in order to continue to provide auto repair services to her customers.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and accessories to sell in her auto repair shop, as well as tools for the service she provides.

loans.name: Aleksandr

texts.en:
Aleksandr lives in Kapan town with his parents. His father is a pensioner, and his mother works at the school of Geghi village, which is located near Kapan.  

Aleksandr is involved in cattle breeding. Currently he keeps cows, chickens, and colonies of bees. Aleksandr has applied for this loan to expand his farm. In particular, he wants to purchase a cow and an ox. This will allow Aleksandr to gather more income from the sales of milk and meat and continue investing in the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: to pay for a cow and an ox

loans.name: Narangerel

texts.en: Narangerel is 54 years old and lives with her husband and two children, aged 34 and 20 respectively, in a ger in Suhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her husband works as a keeper at a car parking lot. Her daughter is a college student. Narangerel started a livestock hides retailing business in 2007 with the help of her son. Today, she is a retailer of livestock animal meat. She purchases cattles and sheep from herders in the countryside to resell them in the town. Sometimes she supplies meat to the capital city of Mongolia. She has gained good experience on the livestock meat supply as a hardworking and good communicating woman. She is asking for 1,300,000 MNT to increase the working capital to purchase 20 sheep from the countryside.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sheep from the countryside

loans.name: Myriam Francisca

texts.es: Myriam tiene 53 años ya vivido desde que nació en Libertad, vive con sus hijos en una casa de su propiedad misma que cuenta con los servicios básicos. El negocio que tiene es la venta puerta a puerta de productos plásticos. Lo inicio al quedarse sola por lo que tuvo que buscar una fuente de trabajo y sacar adelante a sus hijos. Empieza su recorrido desde las 3 de la tarde hasta las 6 todos los días, por lo general lo realiza sola pero algunas veces sus hijos la acompañan por turnos ya que es peligroso porque lleva mercadería o dinero. Entre los productos que ofrece lo que más vende son las Jarras, reposteros, bandejas, tasas y platos etc., todos sus productos son de plásticos los cuales son apreciados por las familias con niños pequeños. Es para la compra de estos productos que Myriam está solicitando el crédito, espera a futuro poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Myriam is 53 years old and has lived in Libertad since she was born. She lives with her children in her own house, which has basic utilities. Myriam has a business selling plastic products door-to-door. She began her business when she became single, because she had to find a source of income and raise her children. She travels to sell her products from 3:00 pm until 6:00 pm every day, and usually travels alone, although sometimes her children come with her if it is dangerous to carry merchandise or money. Her best-selling products include pitchers, containers, trays, cups, and plates, etc. All of her products are plastic, making them popular with families who have small children. Myriam is asking for this loan to buy more of these products, and hopes to be able to improve her quality of life in the future.

loans.use: to purchase pitchers, containers, trays, cups, and plates.

loans.name: Weniger

texts.es:
Weniger tiene 36 años, es un hombre que siempre está activo, le gusta mucho sentirse útil y trabajar para la manutención de su familia. Su pareja es Nolita, de 34 años, con quien tiene un hijo de 8 años llamado Fernando.

Cuando algún vecino, conocido o cliente desea realizar una edificación, construir una pared o implementar sus instalaciones eléctricas, no dudan en llamar de inmediato a Weniger. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 4 años de manera independiente, ya que antes trabajaba bajo la autoridad de otras personas y fue de esta forma como aprendió y ganó mucha experiencia para poder hacerlo ahora con mucho esmero y responsabilidad. Le está yendo muy bien, tiene muchos contratos y siempre realiza su trabajo con resultados óptimos y con todos los implementos de seguridad que requiere, ya que no desea generar o sufrir accidentes que lamentar. Cuando trabajaba para otras personas tenía pocos ingresos y dependía mucho de lo que le pagaban, pero ahora tiene autonomía en su economía. 

Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está muy contento por el apoyo financiero que está recibiendo y agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito. Además, se compromete a ser puntual, una vez más, con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que no desea tener una imagen de irresponsabilidad dentro del grupo al que pertenece, el cual desea integrar por mucho mas tiempo.
Con el monto solicitado, 1500 nuevos soles, comprará herramientas (desarmadores, pinzas, navaja de electricista, guías, martillo y pistola para soldar) para continuar con su trabajo.
texts.en:
Weniger is 36 years old and is a very active man. He likes very much to feel useful and works to support his family. His partner is Nolita who is 34 years old and with whom he has a son of 8 years who is called Fernando. 

When a neighbour, acquaintance or customer wants to construct a building, wall or put in place electrical facilities, they do hesitate in calling Weniger. He has been working independently in this area for 4 years. Previously worked under the supervision of others and this is how he learnt. He needed to gain a lot of experience to be able to do what he is doing now very carefully and responsibly. It is going well for him, he has many contracts and always carries out his work with good results and with all the safety equiptment he needs, since he does not want to create or suffer accidents which he will later regret. 

When he worked under the superivision of others he had very little income and was very dependent on what he was paid, but now he is financially independent. 

This is his second loan with MFP and he is very happy for the financial support he is recieving and thanks everybody who has made his loan possible. He promises to be punctual again with his repayments, as he does not want to be seen as irresponsible within the group, of which he wants to be a member for much longer. 

With the amount he is asking for, 1500 nuevos soles, he will buy tools (screwdrivers, pliers, an electrician’s knife, guides, a hammer and a welding gun) to continue with his work.

loans.use: to buy the tools he needs for his work as a bricklayer and electrician.

loans.name: Luís Alonso

texts.es:
Luís tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica desde hace varios años a realizar trabajos agrícolas y a la albañilería estos oficios los aprendió de sus padres. Él, su esposa y sus hijos viven en una casa construida de lámina.  

Se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para salir a trabajar de jornalero hasta las 7:30 a.m. luego se dirige a trabajar como albañil desde las 8:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. los materiales los compra en una ciudad que esta a una hora en autobús. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para construir un muro de contención en su vivienda, para evitar que el terreno se siga erosionando. Así, él estará más tranquilo que su familia y su vivienda ya no corran peligro. Él planea construir una vivienda de ladrillo, debido a que en la que vive es de lámina y no es segura.
texts.en:
Luís is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He has been working in various agricultural and masonry jobs for years. He learned those trades from his father. He, his wife, and their children live in a house constructed of metal sheets.

He gets up at 4:30 a.m. to go to work as a laborer until 7:30 a.m. Then he goes to work as a mason from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. He buys materials in a city that is one hour away by bus.

He is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to build a containment wall for his house, to avoid the continued erosion of the land. This way, he will rest assured that his family and his home are not in any danger. He also plans to build a brick house, since the one he lives in is made of metal sheets and is not safe.

loans.use: to build a containment wall for his home, to avoid continued erosion of the land

loans.name: Julio Fredis

texts.es:
Don Julio tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde los 10 años de edad, su papá fue quien le enseño, pues él siempre le inculco que debía trabajar. Después, cuando se caso, con más razón tenia que luchar por su familia.

Además de la agricultura, su papá también le enseño la albañilería, reparar zapatos y ha elaborar monturas para caballos. Don Julio agradece mucho a su papá por haberle enseñado tanto, pues debido a las circunstancias de la vida le ha tocado hacer de todo; debido a que su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen en la universidad, para que no pasen por lo que él ha vivido, aunque don Julio manifiesta sentirse orgulloso de todo lo que le enseño su papá; pero como todo padre desea algo mejor para sus hijos.

Él se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. para realizar algunas actividades en su hogar, luego se traslada al lugar donde trabaja y regresa a su casa hasta las 5:00 p.m. lo que necesita para realizar su trabajo una parte la compra en el pueblo y algunas veces tiene que viajar a la ciudad a traer materiales para reparar zapatos y monturas. Para llegar al pueblo tiene que caminar a pie durante diez minutos, luego aborda un autobús que se tarda una hora; pero si va a la ciudad tarda una hora y media. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 17 sacos de abono, una bolsa de semilla y para pago de mano de obra, ya que la milpa necesita la ultima abonada y sembrar maicillo que es donde espera obtener mayores ingresos. Él manifiesta que continuara trabajando muy fuerte para ahorrar y proporcionarles el estudio a sus hijos y si Dios lo permite desea dejarles una casa a sus hijos, debido a que actualmente viven en casa de un familiar.
texts.en:
Julio is 57 years old, married, and has two children. He has made a living in agriculture since he was 10 years old. His father was the one who taught him, and he always instilled in him that he should work. Later, when Julio got married, with more reason he had to fight on behalf of his family. 

Apart from agriculture, his father also taught him bricklaying, how to repair shoes, and how to make horse saddles. Julio is grateful to his father for having taught him so much; due to the circumstances of his life, he has had to do everything. Owing to the fact that his dream is that his children graduate from the university, in order for them not to experience what he has lived, even though Julio expresses pride of all that his father taught him; but like all fathers, he wishes something better for his children.

He gets up at 4:30 a.m. in order to carry out some activities in his home, and then he goes to the place where he works and returns to his house at 5 p.m. In order to complete his work, he buys some of the needed materials in the town and sometimes he has to travel to the bigger city to bring materials to repair shoes and saddles. In order to get to the town, he has to walk ten minutes, and then he boards a bus that takes an hour, but if he goes to the bigger city, the bus ride is an hour and a half. 

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy 17 sacks of fertilizer and a bag of seeds, and to pay for the labor. The crops need the final fertilizing and to sow corn there he hopes to obtain greater income. He expresses that he will continue working very hard to save and provide for the schooling of his children, and if God allows it, he hopes to leave a house for his children, since currently they live in a relative's house.

loans.use: to buy 17 sacks of fertilizer and a bag of seeds, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Bertha Angela

texts.es: Bertha es una mujer luchadora la cual ha salido adelante junto a su familia, ella se dedica a la venta de billeteras y zapatos de manera ambulante. Realiza este trabajo por la necesidad de incrementar sus ingresos ya que su esposo como guardia de seguridad en una residencia no ganaba el dinero necesario. Ella sale desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde a recorrer la ciudad vendiendo sus productos. Una de sus mayores preocupaciones es la distancia que hay desde su casa hasta la ciudad ya que vive en un recinto alejado de Libertad, espera que en un tiempo coloquen una línea de transporte que la lleve sin problemas. Con el préstamo que está solicitando va a comprar productos para la venta esperando incrementarlas y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Bertha is a fighter who has succeeded together with her family. She works selling wallets and shoes as a street vendor. Bertha began this work because she needed to increase her income, as her husband's job as a security guard did not pay enough. She travels the city selling her products from 10:00 am until 6:00 pm. One of her biggest worries is the distance from her house to the city, because she lives in an area outside of Libertad. She hopes that someday there will be a public transport line that can bring her to the city without problems. With the loan she is asking for, Bertha will purchase products to sell, hoping to earn more and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wallets and shoes.

loans.name: Zulma Yanira

texts.es:
Zulma tiene 28 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Ella tiene mucha experiencia en la crianza de bovinos, debido a que su papá los creció en el manejo de ganado. Los animales los compra en el tiangue que esta a quince minutos de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas para engordarlas en la época lluviosa, ya que su papá tiene mucho pasto para alimentarlas en sus terrenos. Ella pretende que al pasar la época de lluvia, las vacas estén gordas y en mejores condiciones para venderlas a un buen precio y obtener ganancias para comprar vacas lecheras y procesar la leche para vender la leche, guajada, crema y queso, porque en la zona no hay quien venda productos lácteos.
texts.en:
Zulma is 28 years old, married and has two children. She has a lot of experience raising bovines, as her father brought them up looking after cattle. She will buy the animals in Tiangue which is fifteen minutes from her house. 

She is asking Fundacion Campo for this loan to buy two cows for fattening during the rainy season, since her father has a lot of pasture to feed them on his land. Her aim is to have the cows fattened at the end of the rainy season and in better condition for sale at a good price, to obtain the income to buy milk cows so that she can sell milk, cottage cheese, cream and cheese because no one in the area sells these dairy products.

loans.use: to buy two cows for fattening during the rainy season.

loans.name: Edson Vicente

texts.es: Edson es un Quevedeño con muchas ganas de salir adelante junto a su familia. Aprendió el comercio de joven cuando vivía en la ciudad capital e ingreso a trabajar en un almacén, al regresar a su ciudad natal tomo la iniciativa de comenzar su propio negocio con un capital que había reunido. Gracias a Dios su decisión fue la más acertada ya que vive de su negocio. El trabajo lo realizan solo todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde. Recorre varios sector promocionando edredones, sabanas, planchas, sillas plásticas etc, vende a contado o a crédito si es una persona conocida no se arriesga mucho porque perdería capital y ganancias en su mercadería. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de estos productos así podría ofertar mas ampliando su clientela. Su sueño es abrir una tienda de venta de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Edson is from Quevedo and is keen to get ahead together with his family. Her learnt how  to work as a salesman from when he was very young. He lived in the country’s capital city and started to work in a shop. When he returned to his home town he took the initiative of opening his own shop with the money he had saved. 

Thank god his decision was a very good one since he makes his living from his business. He works every day from seven in the morning until six in the evening. He goes from place to place selling eiderdowns, sheets, irons, plastic chairs etc. He sells either for cash or on credit because he is a very well-known person and does not take many risks as he may lose his capital and the income from his sales. He is asking for loan to buy these products so that he can offer a wider range to his customers. His dream is to open his own shop selling electrical appliances.

loans.use: to buy eiderdowns, sheets, irons and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 34 años, es una mujer amable y buena, madre soltera de dos niños de 14 y 9 años con quienes vive, en su casa propia, la que consiguió con mucho esfuerzo al lado de su ex cónyuge.
Su trabajo es la venta de cosméticos y productos de aseo personal, vende todo tipo de artículos mediante catálogos, pero también tiene un espacio de exhibición en su casa. Lleva en esta actividad 7 años, anteriormente alternaba con la venta de jugos o ropa, pero no le han dado buenos resultados y tuvo que dejar esas actividades. A pesar de ello no desiste y ahora ha visto la oportunidad de construir locales para negocio y alquilarlos, pues tiene un terreno disponible y desea sacarle provecho, actualmente está en el proceso de construcción. Por lo pronto, continúa trabajando en la venta de cosméticos y le gusta lo que hace, asegura sus ganancias con los clientes que ya ha logrado consolidar con el paso de los años, está muy contenta por la independencia que tiene y porque puede generar ella misma sus propios ingresos para solventar los gastos necesarios en su hogar.

Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo cual agradece a quienes hacen posible su financiamiento para continuar en el camino del cumplimiento de sus metas. Del mismo modo, se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad, y se siente muy tranquila trabajando al lado de los integrantes de su banco comunal, ya que todos sus miembros son muy buenos y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, comprará perfumes, talcos, cremas de piel, aretes, cosméticos, acondicionadores y otros productos para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Amalia is 34 years old and is a very friendly and good woman. She is a single mother of two children, aged 14 and 9 years old, who live with her in her own house, which she obtained with a lot of efforts at the side of her ex spouse. 

Her work is the sale of cosmetics and toiletries. She sells all types of goods through catalogs, but she also has a display space in her house. She has worked on this activity for 7 years. Before that, she alternated with the sale of juices or clothing, but they did not give her good results and she had to leave those activities. In spite of that she does not give up, and now she has seen the opportunity to build premises for businesses and to rent them. She has an available piece of land and hopes to derive benefit from it. Currently she is in the process of construction. For now, she continues working in the sale of cosmetics and likes what she does. She makes sure of her profits with the customers that she has already achieved in consolidating with the passing of the years. She is very happy with the independence that she has and because she herself can generate her own income in order to pay for the necessary expenses in her home. 

This is her first loan from MFP, for which she is grateful to those who make possible the financing so that she can continue on the road of achieving her goals. In the same way, she is committed to punctually making her payments with a lot of responsibility, and she feels very calm working at the side of the members of the communal bank, given that all of its members are very good and supportive. 

With the amount requested, 1000 nuevo sols [Peruvian currency], she will buy perfumes, talc, skin creams, earrings, cosmetics, hair conditioners, and other products to offer for her customers.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics, perfumes, and toiletries in order to increase her stock.

loans.name: José Agustín

texts.es:
Don José tiene 46 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde hace cinco años es empleado en una universidad ejerciendo la laborar de prestar seguridad a la institución.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar los materiales para construir una pila que le servirá para almacenar agua, debido a que en la actualidad solo tiene un chorro y unos barriles que los llena de agua. Con la construcción de la pila podrá almacenar una buena cantidad de agua y sin desperdiciarla, ya que cuando llena el barril el agua se desperdicia y esto significa un precio más alto en la factura del agua. Después, desea construir una galera con lámina a la pila e ir mejorando poco a poco la vivienda.
texts.en:
José is 46 years old and married with three children. For five years he has worked for a university, providing security for the institution. 
The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy the materials for building a basin to store water, as he currently has only a tap and some barrels that he fills with water. With the construction of a basin, he will be able to store a good amount of water without wasting any; when he fills the barrel the water is lost, meaning a higher price on the water bill. Later, he wishes add a shed with sheets of metal to the basin and little by little continue improving his house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for building a basin that he will use to store water.

loans.name: Gerson

texts.es:
Gerson tiene 24 años, es un hombre que le gusta mucho estar a lado de su familia y trabajar honradamente para poder brindarles una mejor calidad vida. Junto a su pareja, por más de 8 años, llamada Gina, es padre de un hijo de 6 años llamado Jefferson.

Él es un hombre precavido y esta cualidad le sirve mucho en su trabajo porque considera que es importante tener siempre calma y sobre todo buen tino para desempeñarse como mototaxista (taxi en motocarro). Es consciente que cuando un pasajero accede a su vehículo, pone en sus manos también su seguridad y su vida para que llegue a su destino sano y salvo. Trabaja por las tardes, su motocarro es propio, pudo comprarlo a base de esfuerzo y mucho sacrificio, ya que antes tenía que alquilar y así ganaba mucho menos. Lleva realizando su trabajo por 5 años, pero eventualmente trabaja también como albañil, actualmente participa en la construcción de una escuela de su zona, se dedica a este oficio desde hace 3 años. Le está yendo muy bien en lo que hace, tiene muchas personas que lo contratan para que las transporten por horas completas y así tiene mejores ganancias. Ahora se está preparando para poder incrementar sus ganancias y comprar un motocarro más para alquilarlo y tener un ingreso adicional.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se siente muy tranquilo trabajando con el grupo al que pertenece, está a gusto con el asesor crediticio que orienta a su grupo y espera continuar de la misma forma. Además, se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en créditos anteriores.

Con el monto solicitado, 1000 nuevos soles, podrá refaccionar algunas piezas de su motocarro que por el tiempo y el mal estado de la calles se empezaron a deteriorar. Otra parte del dinero lo destinará al pago de su nuevo motocarro.
texts.en:
Gerson is 24 years old; he is a man who loves to be at his family’s side and to work honorably to be able to offer them a better quality of life. With his partner of more than 8 years, Gina, he is the father of a 6-year-old son named Jefferson.

He is a prudent man and this characteristic has served him well in his work, because he believes that it’s important to always be calm, and above all to have good judgment, in order to work as a moto-taxi driver (a taxi in a three-wheeled motorcar). He realizes that when a passenger enters his vehicle, they put both their lives and their security in his hands so that they arrive to their destination safe and sound. 

He works in the afternoon, and the motorcar belongs to him; he was able to buy it with a lot of effort and much sacrifice. Before that he had to rent and he earned much less. He has been doing this work for 5 years, but eventually he also started working as a construction worker. He is currently involved in the construction of a school in the area, and he has had this position for 3 years. It’s going very well for him; he has many people who hire him to transport them, giving him full hours, so he has better earnings. Now he is preparing to be able to increase his earnings and purchase one more motorcar, so he can rent it out and have an additional income. 

This is his second loan with MFP, and he feels very content working with the group to which he belongs. He is comfortable with the loan adviser who directs his group, and he hopes to continue in the same way. In addition, he is committed, once again, to punctually paying off his installments as he has done for previous loans. 

With the requested amount, 1000 nuevos soles, he will be able to repair some parts of his motorcar that, due to time and the poor condition of the roads, have begun to deteriorate. Another portion of the money will go toward paying for his new motorcar.

loans.use: to repair his moto-taxi and to pay for a portion of the price of another motorcar.

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
Belén tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y amable, siempre hizo frente a las adversidades al lado de Walter, con quien ya tiene 33 años de convivencia. Trabajó mucho para poder sacar adelante a sus cuatro hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes.
Su actividad laboral es la venta de comestibles variados como gaseosas, harinas, golosinas y otros productos envasados, en las poblaciones aledañas a su ciudad. Quincenalmente traslada, por río, todo lo que tiene para vender, en viajes que pueden tardar hasta una semana de recorrido. Trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo, quien se encarga de movilizar la pesada mercadería. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 10 años y le va muy bien. Cuando se encuentra en la ciudad ayuda a su esposo en la fabricación de puertas y ventanas de fierro, por otra parte tiene un motocarro que alquila a un conductor y por el cual recibe un pago diario. Belén espera seguir trabajando y poder aumentar su capital para poder tener mayor cantidad de productos para vender.

Este es su crédito número 19 con MFP y está muy contenta porque le brindan la oportunidad de acceder a este financiamiento. Se compromete, una vez más, a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo hizo en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Y está muy satisfecha trabajando en su banco comunal, ya que considera que todos sus miembros son personas muy responsables, confiables y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado, 3000 nuevos soles, comprará 50 cajas de gaseosas y otros productos para enviarlos a otras localidades.
texts.en:
Belen is 54 years old and is a very straightforward and friendly. She has always faced all of life’s challenges side by side with Walter, with whom she has now lived for 33 years. She worked very hard to improve the situation of her four children, who are now adults and independent. 

Her business is the sale of various food and drinks, such as soft drinks, flours, sweets and other packaged products, in the outskirts of her city. Every two weeks she transports, by river, everything she has to sell, in trips which can take over a week. She works with the help of her husband, who moves the heavier merchandise. She has had this business for about 10 years and it is going very well for her. When she is in the city she helps her husband with the manufacture of iron doors and windows. She also has a car which she lends to a driver and for which she receives daily payment. Belen hopes to continue working and to increase her capital to have a larger quantity of products for sale. 

This is her 19th credit with MFP and she is very happy because they have offered her the opportunity for this finance. She promises to once again make her repayments punctually, as she has done with her previous loans. She is very happy working in her communal bank, since she considers that all of the members are responsible, trustworthy and supportive of each other. 

With the amount she is asking for, 3000 soles, she will buy 50 cartons of soft drinks and other products to send to other towns.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks and other products to continue with her sales.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
This is Rubelyn. She previously obtained a 13,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her child and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her child. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Rubelyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Liela

texts.en:
Liela is 35 years old. She is from the town of Cabatuan. Liela is married with two children. Right now, Liela is engaged in direct-selling business. She has been in this business for three years and she usually receives a net income of PHP 2,000 every month. 

At this moment, Liela wants to have additional capital. In this regard, Liela is requesting a loan in the amount of PHP 25,000 to purchase lotion, lipstick, shoes, t-shirts and cologne to offer and sell in their village. She believes that through her small business she will be able to see her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase lotion, lipstick, shoes, t-shirts and cologne to offer and sell in their village

loans.name: Magdalena Paula

texts.es: Magdalena tiene en la ciudad de Quevedo una tienda de abarrotes la cual ella administra, la empezó cuando vio la necesidad de abrir este tipo de negocio porque no había en su sector. El negocio lo administra y lo atiende sola todos los días desde muy temprano, en el vende solo los productos de primera necesidad ya que así tiene asegurada sus ventas, entre ellos están el arroz y azúcar por libras, víveres, colas, jugos, enlatados, artículos de limpieza. Ella no está casada pero tiene una hija de 12 años quien es la razón más importante por la que ha luchado para salir adelante. Con el préstamo va a comprar productos para surtir su negocio y poder estar más tranquila ya que así venderá más y podrá cubrir sus gastos y el préstamo.
texts.en:
Magdalena runs a grocery store in the city of Quevedo. She started this business because she saw there was no other such business in the area. She manages and looks after the business herself every day from very early in the morning. She sells essential items since she needs to ensure she makes sales. She sells, amongst other things, rice and sugar by the pound, general supplies, soft drinks, juices, canned foods and cleaning products. 

She is not married but has a 12-year-old daughter who is her most important reason to continue fighting to get ahead. With the loan she will buy products to supply her business so that she can feel more secure and in this way she will be able to sell more and cover her costs and the loan.

loans.use: amongst other things, rice and sugar by the pound, supplies, soft drinks, juices, canned products and cleaning products.

loans.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita is from the village of Del Pilar. She is 37 years old and is married. Rebelita is engaged in direct-selling business which sells blouses, shoes, lipstick and lotion in the local community.  She has been in her business for over six years.

Rebelita is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. She hopes that she can get the amount she requested to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She operates a small retail business selling soap, shampoo, perfumes, and other cosmetics. Rose has been running this business for three years. She intends to use her loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to purchase more personal use products such as shampoo, soap bars and detergent to sell. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a wholesale one. She also hopes that someday she can renovate her house to have better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more personal use products such as shampoo, soap bars and detergent to sell

loans.name: Zaven

texts.en: Zaven is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows, sheep, and chickens, keeps beehives, cultivates wheat, barley, and potatoes, and grows different fruit trees. To start and organize the sowing process, Zaven needs some investments. In particular, he needs to purchase diesel fuel for agricultural machines and hire workers to sow and gather the harvest. This loan will help Zaven to make the sowing process properly and gather the harvest, which is important for him to earn enough income to sustain his family. Zaven lives with his wife and parents.

loans.use: to pay for diesel fuel and hiring workers for sowing

loans.name: Cindy

texts.es:
Cindy tiene 21 años, es una joven mujer trabajadora, madre de una niña llamada Kaori de 4 años, a quien cría en la casa de sus suegros, junto a su pareja, Alex.
Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado. Tiene un puesto de ventas en uno de los mercados más concurridos de su localidad y afortunadamente tiene buenas ventas y considerables ganancias. Pero este trabajo merece de mucho sacrificio, ya que para conseguir buenos y frescos productos tiene que madrugar e ir al puerto de la ciudad a las 4 de la mañana; sin embargo, ella sabe que todo su esfuerzo vale la pena y es recompensado al ver que su pequeña hija tiene todo lo necesario. Lleva en este negocio recién 6 meses, trabaja al lado de su cónyuge, reconoce que aún no tiene la experiencia necesaria, pero afirma que las ganas por hacer las cosas bien y generar ingresos económicos para su familia son su principal motivo para ir en busca del progreso.

Este es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por tanto agradece la oportunidad y confianza que ponen en ella para recibirlo. Por otro lado, se compromete a cumplir con el pago puntual de sus cuotas como lo hizo en créditos anteriores. Y además le agrada ser parte del banco comunal al que pertenece, ya que ha visto que sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.
El monto solicitado (S/. 1000) lo invertirá en la compra de pescados de las mejores especies y tamaños, su inversión diaria varía entre 1000 soles con la compra de aproximadamente 200 kilos de mercadería.
texts.en:
Cindy is a hardworking young 21-year-old woman. She is the mother of a 4-year-old girl name Kaori whom she is raising in her in-laws' home together with her partner, Alex.

She makes a living selling fish. She has a sales stall in one of the busiest markets in the area and, fortunately, she has had good sales and made a considerable profit. However, this work takes a lot of sacrifice. In order to get good, fresh product, she has to get up very early in the morning and go to the city's port at 4:00 in the morning. Still, she knows that all of this effort is worth it, especially when she sees that her little daughter has everything she needs. She has been in this business for 6 months and she works along side her partner. She knows that she still does not have all of the necessary experience, but she asserts that she will get the experience by doing things well and making an income for her family, her main goal being to continue getting ahead.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. She is grateful for the opportunity and the trust placed in her in order to receive the loan. In addition, she has committed to paying the loan back punctually, just as she has with the previous loans. She is also thankful to be a part of her communal bank as she has seen that its members are responsible and united. 

She will invest the 1,000 PEN requested in the purchase of the best types and sizes of fish. Her daily investment is around 1,000 PEN with the purchase of approximately 200 kilograms of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more fish in order to continue her sales.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann lives with her family in a peaceful village in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She and her husband help each other in managing a farming business in order to support their living needs. Rice, potatoes, and some types of seasonal vegetables are their common crops grown for sale. Together, they are able to yield approximately USD 5.00 per day. Vann has been in the business for over 30 years. She is now 55 years old and married with three children; one is employed and the other two are married. Her employed child is very grateful and often shares a part of his monthly salary to help the family. His challenge is that he doesn’t own a vehicle for self-use in order to cut down his transportation costs. In order to help her son in this, Vann has applied for a loan of USD 500 to purchase a motorcycle for her child to use in commuting to his workplace. This time Vann will be able to increase savings for the family, and later she can use it for the future expansion of the business as well as for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her child to use in commuting to his workplace.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma. She previously accessed an 12,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

Emma would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Emma dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She also hopes to have a growing network of customers. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of mineral water products needed in her business

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en: Avelina is married and has three children. She sells groceries such as sugar, assorted breads, oil and noodles. Her small store is located in her house. She has been working in this business for three years. Avelina chose this type of work to help her husband and to have more income for the household. Right now, Avelina is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy additional grocery stocks such as condiments, canned goods and assorted breads for her store. Avelina's dream is to see her business grow until it becomes a large grocery store. She is a very enterprising person. Together with her husband, she is very optimistic about getting her children ahead. She is very grateful for the opportunity to grow and to reach her dreams.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery stocks such as condiments, canned goods and assorted breads for her store

loans.name: George

texts.en: George is a married man aged 64 years, living in Kagadi, Uganda, with 4 children. He owns a retail shop business which he has run for a period of 4 years. He got the capital from the milling machine that he still owns. He says inadequate capital is affecting the business. He would like to build a permanent home and buy land to grow crops. George wants a loan to buy sugar and salt for sale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for sale.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
This is Catherine. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more stocks of school supplies and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stocks of school supplies and products needed in her business. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Catherine dreams of giving her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, which is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional stocks of school supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Akouavi's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est constitué de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Akouavi, la responsable est âgée de 38 ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 9 ans. Elle a une boutique où elle vend des boîtes de conserve, des savons et des produits vivriers depuis des années. Akouavi fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés de la sous région. Expérimentée dans le crédit, Akouavi  a sollicité et a obtenu au micro crédit à Finadev en vue d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire la demande ses clients. Le gain généré par ce crédit lui permettra de participer la scolarisation de ses enfants et de payer des médicaments pour son enfant benjamin qui est malade.
texts.en: This group is made up of two people in joint guarantee. Akouavi, the leader, is 38 years old. She is married with three children all of whom attend school,  the oldest being 18 and the youngest 9 years old. She has a shop where she has been selling tins of conserve, soap, and food products for several years. Akouavi buys her stock in one of the local markets. Experienced in credit, Akouavi has requested and obtained a loan from Finadev with a view to increasing her turnover and satisfying the demands of her customers. The profit generated by this credit will enable her to help pay for the school fees for her children and to pay for medication for her youngest child who is ill.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of macaroni,15 packets of candles,1/2 a box of conserve and 1 box of mixed soaps.

loans.name: Timagui Group

texts.fr: Cultivateur de profession depuis 2000, Mr Kouma est le responsable du groupement TIMAGUI. Il est né en 1969, marié à une ménagère et père de 06 enfants. Il cultive du maïs, du haricot et le vend à ses clients. Toute son activité est basée en RÉGION CENTRALE. Pour l’avancement du travail un membre de la famille et 03 employés l’aident. Il sollicite son troisième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des outils de travail et avoir un bon rendement. Il veut acheter une moto pour son déplacement, augmenter sa superficie cultivable et construire une maison. C’est une association constituée de femmes et d’hommes qui sont tous dans l’agriculture. Ils cultivent du mais, du sorgho, du haricot.
texts.en: Mr. Kouma, who has been a farmer by profession since the year 2000, is the leader of the TIMAGUI group. He was born in 1969, is married to a housewife and father of six children. He grows corn and beans and sells them to his clients. All his activities are based in the Central Region. In order to work faster,  a member of the family and three employees help him. He requests a third loan from WAGES in order to purchase tools to improve his production. He wants to buy a motorbike to facilitate his mobility, increase his cultivable acreage, and build a house. This is an association of men and women who all work in farming. They grow corn, sorghum, and beans.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Souroubia Group
