She is a member of the group "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" [Achieving Our Goals], which is in its sixth loan cycle. The group is very responsible and makes its payments promptly. For a year, Yolanda has managed an internet booth business, which she began with a small loan. Slowly, she had added equipment and improved service. Her children help her by taking turns working at her business. The loan will be used to pay for computer maintenance.

She and the other members of "Alcanzando Nuestras Metas" are very grateful to Kiva lenders because their support gives the members an opportunity to grow financially and to accomplish their goals, especially to have businesses that cover the cost of educating their children.

loans.use: to pay for computer maintenance.

loans.name: Domitila De Jesus

texts.es:
La Señora Domitila es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 15 años de tener este negocio de venta de Ropa de segunda mano.
Doña Domitila el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra ropa americana, Como pantalones, blusas, camisas, shorts, ropa interior y camisetas. De esta manera incrementara más sus ventas.
Doña Domitila con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas y atender mejor a sus clientes. Espera tener mejores ingresos y así tener mejor forma de vida.
Sus sueños es poder terminar de darles el estudio a sus hijos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Domitila is a very hard worker who is dedicated to her business.  She lives with her husband and children in the Choluteca department of southern Honduras.  She has been running her used clothes business for over 15 years.  

Domitila will invest this loan to purchase american clothes such as pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, and t-shirts.  This way she will increase sales.  She also hopes to increase sales and better serve her customers.  She hopes to increase revenues thus giving her a higher quality of life.  Her dream is to help her children finish their education. 

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts, shorts, underwear, and t-shirts for her business.

loans.name: Tith

texts.en:
Tith is 52 years old, living in a thatched house located in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. Local villagers in this area focus mainly on agricultural business including crop husbandry, especially rice, raising livestock, and the fishing business. As others, Tith is one of the farmers who prefers to grow rice to other crops. She has been doing this business for over 30 years. Tith is married and has four children. She gives thanks to her hard work and patience which allow her to raise and send all her children to school.  

In order to better her living conditions and to satisfy transportation needs of her family, Tith would like to take out a loan of 800 USD to purchase a motorcycle for household use. This purchase will help Tith’s family easily and quickly gain access to the surrounding area and also reduce some expenses on public transportation services.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for household use.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en: Saleh lives in Zarqa. He is a university student at a private university. He pays for his education through working and he is a very hard worker. He hopes to get a loan to help him pay for his next semester and continue with his studies and graduate to work in his own field.

loans.use: to pay for his next semester

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is a 30-year-old married woman who has been living in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. Sok is engaged in a farming business to support her living, primarily growing rice and potatoes on her own farmland. She has been working in this field along with her spouse who is very helpful and supportive in maintaining the farm. Sok has two dependent children who are studying and in need of daily allowances.

Due to insufficient funds, Sok has applied for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,000,000 for renting a tractor to till the land. Also with the borrowed amount, she will purchase seeds to sow on her soil. This loan will take part in developing her current business. She believes that with the help of the loan, she will be able to have a fruitful harvest in the upcoming cropping season. Sok comes to HKL for the first time to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till the land and to purchase seeds.

loans.name: Zohreya

texts.en:
Zohreya is a conservative woman, which is why she asked her son to appear in the photo instead of her.
Zohreya is a 47-year-old mother of 6 children, married for the second time after her first husband passed away. Her 6 kids are from her first marriage. She works from her home in trading and selling various products to her neighbors and friends. She wishes to get the loan to bring in more bed covers and cosmetic products so she can start an independent store for trading in the future.  She hopes to afford a better life for her kids and to help her husband with the expenses and bills.

loans.use: to bring in more bed covers and cosmetic products

loans.name: Norma Delia

texts.es:
EL  Banco Comunal Proyección 2000 se reúne cada quince días en la hermosa ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita, rodeada por maravillosas playas y de un clima cálido y agradable, con mujeres hermosas y luchadoras que día a día tratan de sacar adelante a sus familias.

En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 50 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive en su casa. El marido es radiotécnico. 

Nuestra amiga aprendió belleza hace varios años en una academia de esta ciudad y logro el titulo de artesana, para obtener sus propios ingresos y con esto ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y los estudios de sus hijos hace varios años instaló en su casa un salón de belleza, allí ella realiza diversidad de trabajos como tinturados, cortes de cabellos, pintado de uñas entre otras cosas. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde si sus clientes requieren de sus servicios. También vende productos de belleza, lleva más de 28 años dedicada a esta profesión que le ha servido para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar tintes, permanentes y cosméticos que ella vende en su local. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Proyección 2000 meets twice a month in the beautiful city of Portoviejo, capital of Manabí, surrounded by marvelous beaches and warm and pleasant weather, with beautiful women struggling day to day trying to bring up their families.

Norma lives here. She is 50 years old and has a cohabitation relationship from which she has two children who are adults, one of them still living at home. Her husband is a radio technician.

Our friend trained in beauty some years ago in an academy in this city and achieved her beauty license, obtaining her own income and through this helping her husband with the household expenses and the school expenses for her children. Some years ago she outfitted a beauty salon in her home, where she performs lots of jobs such as hair coloring, haircuts, manicures, and more. She works daily from 8:00AM until 8:00PM and sometimes later if her customers require her services. She also sells beauty products. She has been in the business for more than 28 years which has served to provide a good education to her children.

She is going to use this loan to buy hair dye, perm solutions and cosmetics that she will sell in her salon. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she receives from the bank.

Her dream is to succeed in her work.

loans.use: to buy hair dye, perm solutions and cosmetics

loans.name: Imani Group

texts.en:
Modesta is married with six children.  Two of them go to school and two others are still small. He has been selling fish and has had a fruit-and-vegetable business for five years now.  He works from 6:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.
 
This will be his 16th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He paid school fees, bought home furniture, built a small house, purchased a small radio, paid household expenses, started selling fruit and vegetables, sold more fish and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase his stock of fish and to buy more fruit and vegetables to resell. His dream is to one day be able to build a bigger house.

Modesta will share this loan with his loan group, "Imani," with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his fish stock and to buy more fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Halimah

texts.en: Halimah is a 26-year-old single lady living in Karak. She started her own business and has been running it for 3 years so far. She works in clothes trading to be specific. She hopes to start her own shop as she helps support her 3 siblings and herself. She has applied for this youth loan to increase her inventory and the variety of clothes she is selling.

loans.use: to increase her inventory and the variety of clothes she is selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee, bread and other products for consumption for her business.

loans.name: Dixia Dinora

texts.es:
La joven Dixia es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo, ella no tiene hijos y vive en el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 2 años de tener el negocio de venta de tortillas.
Dixia el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña y cal, de esta manera incrementara más sus ventas.
Dixia con el préstamo espera superar sus ventas y satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes.
Dixia también espera obtener mejores ingresos para tener mejor forma de vida. Sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande para que sea más rentable y así poder ayudar su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Dixia is a very hard worker who is 100% dedicated to her business.  She lives with her husband, does not have children, and lives in the Choluteca department in southern Honduras.  She has more than two years running her tortilla sales business.  

Dixia will invest this loan in corn, wood, and lime in the hopes of increasing her sales.  With this loan she hopes to improve her sales and better satisfy the necessities of her customers.  She also hopes to have a higher income to improve her quality of life.  Her dream is to be able to improve her business by making it grow so that it becomes more profitable and this way she will be able to help her family. 

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to purchase corn, wood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Thuraya

texts.en: Thuraya is a 45-year-old mother of four. She lives in Wihdat with her husband and their kids. While she supports her husband by working at an institution to help with bills and expenses, she also works from her home after work in trading and selling various products. She wishes to get a loan to increase the quantity of products and be able to sell more as she sells to her poor neighbors and has them pay in installments rather than the full price.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of products

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: María de 68 años es casada y tiene 01 hijo independiente. Ella cuenta con una bodega la cual ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Lleva más de 10 años en dicho negocio, comenzó vendiendo golosinas y algunos postres que preparaba ella misma,  poco a poco pudo implementar su negocio, ya que actualmente tiene una bodega surtida. María nos comenta que a pesar de la competencia le ha ido bien, ya que ha llegado a fidelizar a sus clientes. Se siente orgullosa pues con su trabajo a mejorado su vivienda y ha mantenido su negocio.  Su mayor deseo es de seguir creciendo en su negocio. El crédito que solicito lo destinara para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas y cervezas  para su bodega. María agradece a los prestamistas Kiva por ayudar a personas como ella.
texts.en:
María, 68, is married and has one independent son.  She relies on a small store where she offers basic products.  She has spent more than ten years in this business.  She began by selling candies and some desserts that she prepared herself, then little by little she was able to add to her business, seeing as now she has a well-stocked store.

María says that in spite of the competition she has done well because she has been able to build loyalty among her customers.  She feels proud since with her work she has improved her life and has maintained her business.  Her greatest desire is to continue growing her business.

The loan that she has asked for will be used to buy drinks like soda and beer for her small store.  María is grateful to the Kiva lenders for helping people like herself.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer.

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim is a farmer who permanently lives in Prey Chor district with her family: her husband and two children. To earn a livelihood, Kim and her spouse cultivate rice on their existing farm lots, around 2.5 hectares. With the generated income from the business, Kim can pay for her daily sustenance, clothes, and allowances for her children. Kim would like to improve her income and upgrade her living standards someday.

Kim is asking for a loan in the sum of 700,000 Cambodian riels (KHR) to repair her house. Due to its old age and the weather factor, some part of it was decayed, so it’s hard for the family to live there. Through this renovation, Kim hopes to provide her family with suitable and comfortable living conditions.

loans.use: to repair broken parts of her house.

loans.name: Fat’Heye

texts.en: Fat’heye, a 44-year-old married woman, lives in Zarqa. A very talented woman and adept multi-tasker, she sells clothes and perfumes, works in embroidery and tailoring, and teaches young children in her neighborhood.  Fat’heye is requesting this loan in order to open her own shop to sell products and have enough space to teach young children.

loans.use: to open her own shop to sell products and have enough space to teach young children.

loans.name: Abla Bernadine

texts.fr: Abla Bernadine est mariée et mère de deux enfants dont un est déjà scolarisé. Son aîné et son benjamin ont respectivement 12 ans et 02 ans. Couturière de profession, Abla Bernadine a un atelier où elle exerce sa profession et vend des pagnes depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue d'augmenter son capital et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de contribuer à l'éducation de ses enfants. Elle envisage aider son mari à achever la construction de leur maison qui est en chantier.
texts.en:
Abla Bernadine is married and mother to two children of whom one is already schooled. Her oldest and her youngest are 12 and 2 respectively. 

Sewer by trade, Abla Bernadine has a workshop where she practices her business and has been selling pagnes [colorful African fabric] for a few years. She gets her supplies in one of the markets of Bénin. 

With the aim of increasing her capital and to fulfill the expectations of her clients, she appealed to Finadev for financing in order to grow her supplemental revenue and to contribute to the education of her children. She envisions helping her husband to achieve the construction of their home which is in construction.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen pagnes [colorful African fabric] of all categories.

loans.name: Progres Group

texts.fr: Mr Limdouh est père de 04 enfants. Tous sont sur les bancs d’école et ils ont entre 18 et 06ans. Sa conjointe est revendeuse. Âgé de 48ans, il exerce comme activité l’agriculture et il cultive du maïs. Ses activités sont toutes basées en RÉGION CENTRALE. Pour mieux répondre aux demandes croissantes des clients, il sollicite l’aide de 04 personnes et il y a de cela 04 ans qu’il est dans ce métier. Mr Limdouh fait partie d’un groupement nommé « PROGRÈS » constitué en majorité des agriculteurs (femmes et hommes) dont il est le président. Ils sollicitent ce prêt pour acheter des outils de travail plus performant afin d’avoir un meilleur rendement. Ils veulent augmenter leurs superficies, prendre en charge les enfants et progresser dans leur vie professionnelle.
texts.en: Mr Limdouh is father to 4 children. All are in school and are between 6 and 18 years old. His spouse is a reseller. 48 years old, he practices farming and cultivates corn. His businesses are all based in the central region. To better respond to the growing demands from his clients, he is requesting help from 4 people and he has been in this profession for 4 years. Mr Limdouh is part of a group named PROGRÈS consisting primarily of farmers (women and men) and he is the president. They are requesting this loan to buy more powerful tools in order to have a better yield. They want to increase their surface areas, take care of the children and progress in their professional lives.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Zenzontle Group

texts.es:
El grupo Zenzontle lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Milagro quien es artesano de hamacas desde hace 21 años. Cuando inicio compraba las hamacas hechas para vender después empezó hacerlas. 
El crédito lo invertirá en manila, argollas, bolillas, pelota y mano de obra.
Las otras integrantes son Elba Rosa quien tiene una pulpería, Alma vende pan desde hace 5 años y María Teresa vende frutas y frijoles cocidos.
texts.en:
The Zenzontle group of comprised of four hard-working and enterprising people.  Milagro is one of them.  She has been making hammocks for 21 years.  When she started she bought the hammocks already made to sell.  Later, she started making them.

She will use the loan to buy netted cord, hoops, roller bearings, and ball bearings, and to pay for labor.

The other members are Elba Rosa, who has a grocery store, Alma, who has been selling bread for five years, and María Terersa, who sells fruit and cooked beans.

loans.use: to buy netted cord, hoops, roller bearings, ball bearings, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Cintia Yolany

texts.es:
La joven Cintia es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con sus padres, es soltera. Ella vive en el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 3 años de tener el negocio de pulpería.
Cintia el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, y pan, de esta manera incrementara más sus ventas.
Con el préstamo Cintia espera superar sus ventas y satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes. Para tener mejor forma de vida.
Cintia sus sueños es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande y apoyar a sus padres. 
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Cintia is a very hardworking person who is 100% dedicated to her business.  She lives with her parents and is single.  She lives in the Choluteca department in the south of Honduras.  She has had her grocery store for more than three years.

Cintia will invest the loan in the purchase of meat, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee and bread and in this way she will increase her sales.  With the loan, Cintia hopes to better her sales, improve and satisfy the needs of her customers in order to have a better way of life.  Cintia’s dreams are to be able to improve her business, in making it bigger and helping her parents.

Choluteca, Honduras – July 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, lard, coffee and bread for her business.

loans.name: Elsa Beatriz

texts.es: Elsa una mujer empeñosa de  46 años de edad, es separada y tiene  02 hijos 01 de ellos aún dependiente. A pesar de los obstáculos que se le presentaron en el trascurso de su vida  Elsa ha podido salir adelante. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas, etc. Hace más de 03 años, este negocio surgió gracias a la motivación de su familia y los deseos de mejorar su calidad de vida. Con la buena atención que les da  a sus clientes  Elsa ha podido aumentar su cartera de clientes. Se siente orgullosa pues con su trabajo a podido mejorar su vivienda y darles educación a sus hijos. Su sueño de  Elsa es de poder vender sus productos al por mayor, pues así tendría mejores ingresos. Solicito el crédito para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio comprando arroz, azúcar, fideos, leche, etc. Y así mantener surtido su bodega.  Elsa agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Elsa is a diligent, 46 year old woman.  She is separated and has two children.  One of them is still a dependent.  In spite of the obstacles encountered during her life, Elsa has been able to get ahead.

She has been selling groceries and sweets, etc. for over three years.  This business arose thanks to the motivation of her family and the desire to improve their quality of life.  With the good service that she gives her customers Elsa has been able to increase her portfolio of customers.  She is proud of her work because she has been able to improve her house and give her children an education.  Elsa’s dream is to be able to sell products wholesale.  This way she would have better income.

She requested the loan to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk, etc.  This way she will keep her grocery store stocked.  She is grateful for the loan that has been provided because it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, noodles, and milk.

loans.name: Lezouwe Group

texts.fr: Président du groupement nommé « LEZOUWE », Mr Koudjoukabalo est cultivateur de profession. Il a en charge 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 13ans et le dernier 03ans. Il est âgé de 35ans. Vu qu’il a une superficie considérable, 10 personnes l’aident dans l’exécution de ses taches et il est dans ce domaine il y a 12ans. Ce prêt qu’il sollicite lui permettra d’acheter des outils de travail plus performant afin de mieux répondre aux besoins des clients. Il veut acheter du moulin avec les profits réalisés, augmenter sa superficie et prendre en charge les dépenses de la famille. Les autres aussi sont dans le même domaine d’activité.
texts.en:
The president of the group named "LEZOUWE", Mr. Koudjoukabalo is a farmer by trade, He supports three children, of whom two are in school. The oldest is 13 years old, and the last is three. Mr. Koudjoukabalo is 35 years old. Given he has considerable farmland, ten persons help him in carrying out the work. He has been in this business for twelve years. 

This loan he is requesting will enable him to buy more effective work tools in order to respond better to customer needs. He wants to buy a mill with the profits made, increase his land area, and cover his family expenses. 

The others are also in the same domain of work.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Nathalie Akue Yéyinou's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Yéyinou Nathalie, la responsable, est âgée de 27 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés dans une école du quartier. Avec un niveau d'instruction secondaire, elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des plastiques, des chaussures et des plats depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et ses clients sont composés des étrangers et des béninois. En vue de satisfaire les exigences de ses clients et d'accroître son revenu additionnel, elle a fait recours au financement de Finadev. Le présent financement lui permettra de contribuer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et d'améliorer le régime alimentaire de la famille. Yéyinou Nathalie se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two persons who mutually guarantee one another. Yéyinou Nathalie, the group's official, is 27 years old. She is married and the mother of two children, who are in a neighborhood school. With a secondary school education, she became specialized in selling plasticware, shoes, and plates a few years ago. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin, and her customers are composed of foreigners and Beninese. 

With the aim of satisfying the requirements of her customers and increasing her extra income, she turned toward Finadev financing. The current financing will enable her to help with her children's education costs and to improve her family's diet. 

Yéyinou Nathalie is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 8 dozen pieces of plasticware, 10 pairs of shoes, and 2 dozen plates

loans.name: O. Semayi Solange Diane's Group

texts.fr: Agée de 23 ans, Solange Diane vit auprès de son mari avec un bébé. Elle vend des condiments, des sacs de riz et d'autres produits alimentaires depuis 04 ans. Elle fait ses achats dans les marchés du Bénin et sa clientèle s'élargit sans cesse compte tenu du bon emplacement de son fonds de commerce. Dans le souci de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement à la demande ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéfice d'un micro crédit à Finadev. Le surplus dégagé par ce micro crédit lui permettra d'assurer une bonne éducation à ses enfants et d'avoir accès au courant électrique du Bénin. Solange Diane se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
Solange Diane, aged 23, lives with her husband and a baby. She has been selling condiments, sacks of rice, and other food supplies for four years. She makes her purchases at Beninese markets, and her customer base is ever-growing given that her location and her capital funds are good. 

Concerned about bolstering her sales and responding favorably to customer demand, she requested and obtained a micro-loan with Finadev. The surplus gotten by this micro-loan will enable her to ensure a good education for her children and access to Benin's electricity.

Solange Diane is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacks of rice at 5 kg each, 15 packets of macaroni, a box of couscous, and a basket of tomatoes

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es:
Harold tiene la edad de 36 años, casado, de oficio contratista de construcción, su esposa es ama de casa, padre de 4 hijos de 6meses, 4,11 y 12 años de edad, dos de ellos estudiantes.
Harold ha sido bien trabajador, dedicado a su familia, hace dos años se fue al país de costa Rica, con el objetivo de construir su casa, ya que Vivian con sus suegros, días muy difíciles para él, pero contento porque logro la construcción casi completa de su casa. Ahora para terminar de hacer las mejoras será por medio de financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo a plazos. Ya que los ingresos obtenidos son menos en Nicaragua, y tiene que cubrir todos los gastos. Comprara materiales de construcción para repellar paredes, y embaldosar, y lograr una mejor higiene en su hogar
texts.en:
Harold is 36 years old, married, and works as a construction contractor.  His wife is a housewife, and he has 4 children, ages 6 months, 4, 11, and 12.  Two of them go to school.

Harold has been a good worker who is devoted to his family.  Two years ago he went to Costa Rica to build a house as they lived with his mother and father-in-law.  These were very difficult days for him, but he is happy because he managed to almost complete the construction of his house.

Now, making the improvements will be done in installments through the loan from Afodenic.  He gets less income in Nicaragua, and he needs to cover all of the expenses.  He will use the loan to buy construction materials to plaster the walls, put down tile, and to have better hygiene in his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to plaster the walls and put down tile.

loans.name: Gbenoukounmè Véronique's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux membres en caution solidaire. Gbenoukounmè Véronique, la responsable est âgée de 47 ans. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants dont trois vont encore à l'école, elle vend de l'haricot, du maïs et de la farine de manioc depuis des années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et ses clients sont composés des ménages et des vendeuses de nourriture. En vue d'accroître son fonds de roulement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, Gbenoukounmè Véronique a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui financier lui permettra de renforcer son activité et de maximiser son profit. Le surplus dégagé lui permettra d'offrir des soins médicaux adéquats à ses enfants et de contribuer à leurs éducation. Gbenoukounmè Véronique se retrouve à gauche dan la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two persons who mutually guarantee one another. Gbenoukounmè Véronique, the group's official, is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of three children, who are still in school, she has been selling beans, corn, and cassava flour for years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin, and her customers are composed of homemakers and food sellers.

With the aim of increasing her working capital and responding favorably to the demands of her customers, Gbenoukounmè Véronique requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This support will enable her to bolster her business and maximize her profit. The surplus gotten will enable her to provide adequate medical care for her children and to help with their education. 

Gbenoukounmè Véronique is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a sack of beans, 4 sacks of corn, and a sack of cassava flour

loans.name: Vao

texts.en:
Vao, aged 31, is married with three children who are enrolled in school. She and her spouse can bring up their children and can afford to send them to school by dedicating their time to crops husbandry. They have been managing a farming business for ages, typically earning an average of 14,000 Cambodian rials (KHR) each per day.

Vao would like to make progress in her current business, so she decided to look for a loan in the amount of KHR 2,200,000 to purchase farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizers, and to rent a tractor to till the land. Vao hopes to achieve more plentiful harvests as well as to increase her household income. She wants to reinvest her generated income into this business again in order to expand her productivity.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizers, and to rent a tractor to till the land.

loans.name: Mèdéssè Antoinette's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 38 ans, Mèdéssè Antoinette, la responsable est mariée et mère de cinq enfants scolarisés dans une école de la ville. Spécialisée dans la vente des régimes de bananes en gros et en détail depuis des années, Mèdéssè Antoinette s'approvisionne dans les villages du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux rentabiliser son activité et de satisfaire les exigences de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un concours financier auprès de finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de contribuer à l'éducation de ses enfants. Elle souhaiterait réhabiliter leur maison qui est en ruine. Mèdéssè Antoinette se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group of two persons who mutually guarantee one another. Mèdéssè Antoinette, the group's official, is married and the mother of five children, who are in a school in the city. Specialized in selling bananas wholesale and retail for years, Mèdéssè Antoinette gets her supplies from the villages in Benin. 

Concerned about making her business more profitable and satisfying the requirements of her customers, she requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev with the aim of maximizing her profit and helping with her children's education. She would like to renovate her house, which is in ruins. 

Mèdéssè Antoinette is at the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 100 bunches of bananas

loans.name: Doris De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora Doris de 46 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus tres hijos en la comunidad de El Tular, Honduras tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de pulpería.
Doña Doris solicita el préstamo para comprar refrescos, churros, granos básicos, pollo, con el préstamo ella pretende surtir su negocio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Con el apoyo del préstamo Doña Doris mejorara sus ganancias y por ende tendrá mas producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su deseo es mejorar su negocio hacerlo mas grande y que sea auto sostenible.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Doris de Jesus is 46 years old. She lives with her spouse and her three children in the community of El Tular, Honduras. She has her own home and she has worked for the last three years on her grocery store business.

Doris seeks the loan to buy refreshments, churros, grains and chicken. WIth the loan she intends to stock her business and so to better her quality of life.

With the support of the loan, Doris will increase her earnings and hence she will have more products to offer to her customers. Her wish is to better her business, to make it bigger and so that it will be self sustainable. 

San Lorenzo, Hunduras-July 2012

loans.use: To buy refreshments, churros, grains and chicken for her business.

loans.name: Inna

texts.en: Inna lives in Kapan town with herhusband, Andranik, and 21-year-old daugher, Anahit. Inna's husband works at the local military unit, and her daughter is a hairdresser. Inna is involved in beekeeping. Currently she keeps 15 beehives. Inna has applied for this loan to increase the number of beehives. With the requested amount she plans to purchase 15 colonies of bees and 20 hives for the bees. Income form the sales of honey forms and important of Inna's family income, so development of beekeeping will help her to get additional income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for bee colonies and hives for the bees

loans.name: Yin

texts.en:
Yin, aged 29, owns and operates a small convenience shop at home, selling variety of merchandise such as snack food, sweets, and noodles to local people in her community. From this business, she is able to generate income in the neighborhood of KHR 6,000 per day to cover her daily costs. However, her husband is the main income provider in the family. Yin has two lovely young kids that are in needs of her care.

Now, Yin is asking for a loan in the amount of USD 600 to purchase merchandise to sell in her store such as spices, shampoos, soap, canned items, snack food, soft drinks, and miscellaneous products. She hopes to make her store full of groceries to sell that will satisfy her customers’ needs. Through income she will earn from her business, she will provide her children's basic needs in school and their daily food.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell in her store such as spices, shampoos, soap, canned items, snack food, soft drinks, and miscellaneous products.

loans.name: Armine

texts.en: Armine runs a little shop, where she trades with parfumes, crockery, gifts and different household goods. Armine has started her business in 2000. During this period due to high quality services Armine has gained a large number of loyal clients. Now Armine would like to add inventory with more variety to stay competitive in the market. With the requested amount she plans to purchase crockery, perfumes and gifts. This loan is important for Armine to keep on developing her business and have financial stability. Armine lives with her mother.

loans.use: to pay for crockery, perfumes and gifts

loans.name: Pélagie Agnès

texts.fr: Agée de 42 ans, Pélagie Agnès est divorcée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Elle dispose d'une boutique dans laquelle elle vend des boîtes de conserve, du sucre, des couscous et d'autres produits alimentaires depuis quelques années. Elle fait ses approvisionnements dans les marchés les plus proches de son fonds de commerce. Expérimentée dans le commerce, elle a sollicité et a bénéficié d'un appui financier à Finadev en vue d'augmenter sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de combler les besoins de ses clients. Cet appui financier l'aidera à payer la scolarité de ses enfants et à creuser un puits dans sa maison.
texts.en:
Pélagie Agnès, aged 42, is a divorced mother of two children, both in school. She has a shop in which she has been selling canned foods, sugar, couscous, and other grocery items for a few years. She makes her purchases at the markets closest to her livelihood. 

Experienced in business, she requested and obtained financial support from Finadev with the aim of increasing her ability to stock up on goods and fulfill her customers' needs. This financial support will help her to pay for her children's education and to drill a well at her house.

loans.use: to buy 20 packets of macaroni, a box of couscous, a box of canned milk, a box of mayonnaise, and a box of sugar

loans.name: Santos Hercilia

texts.es:
La Señora Santos es una persona emprendedora muy dedicada a su negocio propio venta de ropa americana en su casa de habitación desde hace mas de 8 años. Actualmente vive con sus 3 hijos y esta soltera.
Doña Santos el préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio en la compra de pantalones, camisas, blusas, y Shorts. Ella espera crecer más con el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Los sueños de Doña Santos en poco tiempo tener una tienda más grande y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos la mejor educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Santos is an entrepreneurial person who is very dedicated to her business selling American clothing from her home for over 8 years. She currently lives with her three children and she is single.

Santos will invest the loan in the business buying pants, shirts, blouses and shorts. She hopes to grow her business more and to satisfy the needs of her customers.

The dreams of Ms. Santos are to soon have a larger store and so to have larger profits and to give her children a better education.

Choluteca, Honduras- July 2012

loans.use: To buy pants, shirts, blouses and shorts for her business.

loans.name: Mirian Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Mirian de 33 años de edad es casada tiene casa propia vive con sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos trabajan,  su esposo es albañil y le apoya económicamente en su hogar, Doña Mirian se dedica desde hace 10 años al negocio de venta de ropa americana usada, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante en los caseríos y aldeas de San Lorenzo y sus alrededores.
Doña Mirian solicita el préstamo para comprar pantalones, blusas, faldas, ropa de niño.
Con el apoyo del préstamo Doña Mirian mejorara sus ganancias y por ende tendrá mas producto que ofrecer a sus clientes, y así tendrá mas dinero para comprar el producto que necesita para seguir  vendiendo y comprar lo que necesita para su familia.
El deseo de Doña Mirian es mejorar su negocio hacerlo mas grande y mas rentable.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Mirian, 33, is married and has her own house where she lives with her 4 children.  Two of them work, and her husband is a bricklayer who supports the household finances.  For 10 years, Mirian has had a business selling used American clothing.  She sells her merchandise from place to place in the rural communities and villages of San Lorenzo and its outskirts.

Mirian is requesting a loan to buy pants, blouses, skirts, and children's clothing.

With the support of this loan, Mirian will increase her earnings and have more products to offer to her customers.  This way, she will have more money to buy the products she needs to continue to sell, and to buy what she needs for her family.

Mirian's wish is to improve her business, making it bigger and more profitable.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, skirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Lidia Bertha

texts.es:
La Señora Lidia es una persona emprendedora muy dedicada a su negocio propio de pulpería en su casa de habitación desde hace más de 8 años. Actualmente vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Su negocio es una pulpería bien surtida.
Doña Lidia el préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio en la compra de café, azúcar, pan, refrescos, harina, lácteos, y frijoles.
Doña Lidia espera crecer más con el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Doña Lidia sus sueños en poco tiempo tener un mini súper y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a sus hijos la mejor educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Lidia is an enterprising person who is very devoted to her business.  She has had a grocery store located in her house for more than 8 years.  She now lives with her husband and their 4 children.  Her grocery store is well stocked.

Lidia will invest this loan in her business, buying coffee, sugar, bread, soft drinks, beverages, flour, dairy products and beans.

Lidia hopes to grow her business more and satisfy the needs of her customers.  She dreams of having a mini-market in the near future, so that she could increase her income and provide her children with the best possible education.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar, bread, soft drinks, beverages, flour, dairy products and beans for her store

loans.name: Muhogo Group

texts.en:
Tumidho, who is in his early 20s is single, he has been running m-pesa and tigo pesa (electronic money transfer) business for one year and six months now. He works from 6.00am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to pay rent, increase business and has paid back all his loans successfully.  He wants a loan to increase m-pesa and tigo pesa stock. His dream is to one day be able to expand more and improving channels of his business.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "Muhogo" which has a total of 13 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase m-pesa and tigo pesa stock.

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima runs a shop, where she trades with clothing, shoes, crockery and fruits and vegetables. Rima started this business in 2008. She has appled for this loan to add more inventory for the shop: clothing, shoes, crockery and vegetables. This is essential for Rima to increase the sales and get more income. 
Rima lives with her 2 sons, daughter-in-law, 1-year-old grandchild and mother-in-law. Rima's sons help her to run the business, development of which is importnat for the family to get sufficient income and meet ends.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, shoes, crockery and vegetables

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is a young farmer from Goris town. He breeds cows, cultivates potato, bean and grows apple and pear trees. Vahe has been running his farm for 5 years. To increase the number of cattle Vahe needs to purchase a neat (cattle), for which he has applied for this loan. This is important for Vahe to expand his farm and develop cattle breeding. 
Vahe lives with his wife, 2-year-old son and mother. The family gets its main income from agriculture. Vahe hopes to increase his income and provide better life quality for his family.

loans.use: to pay for a neat (cattle)

loans.name: Vip Group

texts.en:
Julius, who is in his early 20s, is single.  He has been selling soft drinks and beers for six months now. He works from 6.00am to 9.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be his first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania which he wants  to use for increasing stocks of the grocery.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.  

He will share this loan with his loan group "VIP" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase stock of the  grocery.

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en: Lilit lives in Mrganush village with her parents and 24-year-old brother. The family is involved in agriculture: they raise cattle, cultivate tomato, cabbage, eggplant, grow peach, apricot, plum, cherry, apple, walnut trees and keep a grape orchard. To cover sowing costs in the big farm, Lilit has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizer, medicine, as well as pay fee for the hired land and its watering. This loan will greatly support Lilit and her family to implement all these plans and create good background for gathering rich harvest.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, medicine, fees for watering and land

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed has been hard at work with his provisions shop, where he sells many items. The front of his shop is used as a fast food area, where he fixes oats, tea, fried egg with bread, etc. With this 110,000 Liberian dollar (LRD) loan he was able to buy more inventory (milk, rice, Argo oil, toothpaste, etc) for his shop. He says he has been running this business since 2005. He enjoys the flow of his customers and his daily sales. The problem he is facing is that he is trying to open another branch. 

Mohamed is 45 years old and lives in Compound #3. He is married with four children between the ages of 3 and 15, all of whom live at home. His plan is to have more shops and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more inventory (milk, rice, Argo oil, toothpaste, etc.) for his shop

loans.name: Farman

texts.en: Farman lives in Arteni village with his mother, brother and aunt. Farman is involved in agriculture. He breeds cows, chickens, turkyes and grows apricot and walnut trees. Farman would like to increase the number of cattle by purchasing 2 calves. He also needs to purchase grass to feed the cattle during winter season. To implement these goals Farmna has applied for this loan. Farman will increase his income from agriculture and continue investing in its further development.

loans.use: to pay for calves and grass

loans.name: Ofelya

texts.en:
Ofelya lives in Shaghat village with her 15-year-old daughter, Mariam. Mariam is involved in agriculture: she breeds cows and chickens, grows barley and potato, and grows apple, pear and walnut trees. Ofelya would like to increase the number of livestock in her farm, but she doesn't have sufficient funds. Ofelya has applied for this loan to purchase 2 neats (cattle). This will help Ofelya to breed the cattle and start earning more income from agriculture. 

Ofelya'a husband has apssed away, and she is the only breadwinner in the family. Development of agriculture is important for Ofelya to have stable income and provide better future for her daughter.

loans.use: to pay for 2 neats (cattle)

loans.name: Flamingo Group

texts.en:
Veronica, who is in her late 20s, is single with one child who goes to school.  She has had a tailoring business for one year now. She works from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy a tailoring machine and has paid all her loans successfully. She wants a new loan to buy tailoring materials. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Veronica will share this loan with her loan group "Flamingo" with 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is a divorcee of 54 years with 2 children. She is a farmer and grows bananas along side other crops. She started farming to accumulate income to meet her family demands and pay school fees for her two children being a single mother. She also makes local food stuffs to supplement her income. She will use the money to buy fertilizers for the banana plantation and part of it to buy seeds for planting. She hopes to expand her sales to even bigger markets if the capital and yields accumulate. Limited capital and transport are her major challenges. Kasifa is a very hard working woman..

loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers for the banana plantation

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is 37 years old from the town of San Mmiguel, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a welder. Celestina has multiple small businesses that enable her to help her husband in raising their four school-aged children. She raises hogs, makes bread, sell cosmetics and farms rice too. She is asking for a loan to buy flour, sugar, feed and fertilizer. 

She would like to continue improving her business so she can better provide for her children's basic needs like food and education.

In the future, she would like to make her businesses bigger for a better income.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Barrio Pincha - Chupaca Group

texts.es:
Saludos, reciban todos ustedes desde su hermano país del Perú. El Grupo Barrio Pincha – Chupaca, grupo que ya está iniciando  su cuarto ciclo, se caracterizan por ser solidarios y muy trabajadores, una de sus socias es la Señora Crecenciana, de 54 años, casada y con hijos con mayoría de edad y una nieta, ella empezó con el negocio de ventas de cervezas, ocasionalmente en una fiesta costumbrista de su localidad, al comienzo vendía por menor, pero con el pasar el tiempo y viendo que sus ganancias eran buenas, juntó un pequeño capital para poder vender por mayor y crecer en su negocio  y de esa manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su esposo.
El sueño de ella es poder adquirir un pequeño triciclo, para poder llevar a sus clientes (pequeñas bodegas) las cajas de cerveza, cuando le hacen pedidos, ya que por ahora tiene que llevarlos a veces cargando poco a poco, o alquilando un triciclo.
Ella y los demás socios de este grupo se encuentran completamente agradecidos por el apoyo que reciben tanto de EDAPROSPO y de los inversionistas de KIVA, y se siente feliz porque su historia sea conocida por otras personas de buen corazón.
Cresenciana, viste con una chompa verde clara, y un polo blanco, esta agarrada de la mano con su pequeña nieta.
texts.en:
Greetings to all of you from your brother country of Peru. The Group Barrio Pincha-Chupaca, a group that now is initiating its fourth cycle, is characterized by its solidarity and hard workers. One of its members is Ms. Crecenciana, who is 54 years old, married with children who are older and a granddaughter. She began her business selling beer occasionally in the traditional festivals in her town. At the beginning she sold a little, but with the passing of time and seeing that her earnings were good, she pulled together a little capital to be able to sell more and grow her business. This way she bettered the quality of her life and that of her husband. 

Her dream is to be able to purchase a tricycle to be able to carry to her clients (small stalls) the cases of beer. When they make orders today she has to carry them either by bringing little by little, or by renting a tricycle. 

She and the other members of this group are completely grateful for the support that they have received through EDAPROSPO and the investors from KIVA. She is happy because her story will be known by other people with good hearts. 

Cresenciana, wearing a bright green sweater and a white polo, is holding the hand of her small granddaughter.

loans.use: to buy cartons of beer.

loans.name: Sara Yolanda

texts.es:
La Joven Sara es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su negocio, vive con su esposo y su hijo. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Y tiene más de 4 años de tener el negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Sara el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, leña y cal y molino. Y de esta manera incrementar más sus ventas.
Sara con el préstamo espera incrementar sus ventas y atender mejor a sus clientes con mayor cantidad de producto, también espera tener mejores ingresos y  tener mejor calidad vida.
Los sueños de Sara es poder terminar de pagar su vivienda darle una mejor vida a su hijo, y darle una buena educación.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Sara is a young, hardworking person dedicated to her work. She lives with her husband and her child, in the department of Choluteca in southern Honduras. She has had her business for more than 4 years making and selling tortillas. Sara will use the loan in the purchase of corn, firewood, lime, and a grinder. In this way her sales will increase.

Sara hopes that with this loan her sales will increase and she can serve her customers with a larger quantity of product, and she also hopes to have higher profits and to have a better quality of life.

Sara’s dreams are to be able to finish paying for her home and give her child a better life, along with a good education.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood and a grinder for her business

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Salama»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient, parmi les quels, il y a des infirmiers et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est vendeuse des oignions et ails. Son mari fut lâchement décédé suite à une courte maladie, bientôt 9 ans passé. Elle étale ses marchandises dans un entrepôt. Il y a 16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  10 cycles dans le programme de microcrédit  de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs d’oignions, 2 sacs d’ails.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une  seconde maison pour ses enfants orphelins.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
This client, Bahati, is the representative of the business group "Salama". She is an entrepreneur, 45 years old, and the mother of six children, all in school and who include nurses and those with their own homes. Bahati sells onions and garlic. Her husband died following a short illness almost nine years ago. 

Bahati displays her merchandise at a warehouse. She has been operating this business for sixteen years. However, she just completed ten cycles in the Hekima micro-loan program. This new loan must serve to supply her with 2 sacks of onions and 2 sacks of garlic. 

In addition, her ambition is to educate her children and to build another house for her orphaned children. 

This client thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor women excluded from traditional banks.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of onions and 2 sacks of garlic

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina sigue laborando, Como docente, sus tres hijos estudiando y su esposo labora en mantenimiento de computación, hasta ahora han salido adelante con mejores condiciones de vivienda, al tener estos financiamientos en Afodenic. Sabina está en casa de reposo, ya que se cayó en horas que iba al trabajo, y se quebró su pie, andando con muletas, por cuatro meses, hay días difíciles porque le da mucho dolor y se le dificulta todo.
Con este nuevo préstamo hará una bodega al fondo del patio, y otro baño afuera de la casa, en la parte del fondo de su propiedad. Comprara, materiales en construcción en piedra, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro para hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Sabina is still working as a teacher. Her children are in school, and her husband works in computer maintainance. Up to now she has made progress in improving her house by having these loans with Afodenic.

Sabina is resting at home, as she fell when she was going to work and broke her foot, and has been getting around on crutches for four months. There are difficult days because it causes her a great deal of pain and makes everything more difficult.

With this new loan she will build a storeroom at the back of the patio and another outdoor bathroom at the rear of their property. She will buy construction materials for doing the work, such as stone, cement blocks, sand, cement and steel.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make a storeroom and bathroom at the back of the patio.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Señora Francisca es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada 100% a su negocio, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. En el departamento de Choluteca en el sur de Honduras. Ella tiene más de 2 años de tener el negocio de pulpería.
Doña Francisca el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de carne, pollo, arroz, frijoles, manteca, café, pan, y pastas. De esta manera incrementara más sus ventas.
Doña Francisca con el préstamo espera superar sus ventas y satisfacer y mejorar las necesidades de sus clientes. También espera obtener mejores ingresos para tener una mejor vida.
Los sueños de Doña Francisca es poder mejorar su negocio, en hacerlo más grande y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Francisca is a very hardworking person dedicated one hundred percent to her business. She lives with her husband and her two children, in the department of Choluteca in southern Honduras. She has had her grocery store for more than two years.

Francisca will invest her loan in the purchase of meat, chicken, rice, beans, butter, coffee, bread and pasta. In this way her sales will be increased.

Francisca hopes that with the loan her sales will increase and hopes to better satisfy the needs of her customers. She also hopes to obtain higher earnings to have a better life.

Francisca’s dream is to be able to improve her business, making it larger, and to help her husband with the household expenses.

Choluteca, Honduras - July 2012

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, rice, beans, butter, coffee, bread, and pasta for her business

loans.name: Umayah

texts.en: Umayah is a married woman and the mother of four. She is a conservative person, so she asked her husband to appear in the photo instead of her.They live together in Zarqa. The oldest son opened a small shop to sell cleaning products and materials. His father works there to help his son. Umayah wishes to take out this loan so she can also participate in helping her son. This is a chance to improve and expand their shop by getting other types of cleaning products and increase their profits.

loans.use: to get more types of detergents

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene la edad de 46 años, casado, padre de dos hijos de 17 y 18 años de edad, estudiantes, su esposa es costurera y hoy en día Pedro tiene su propio negocio, un recorrido en mini microbús que trabaja como transporte escolar
Al inicio trabajo en la agricultura, tierras de sus padres, años más tarde comienza a trabajar de chofer privado, luego su papa le heredo parte de tierras lo que vendió y compro el microbús, y que hasta hoy ah sido su medio para salir adelante con su familia. Aunque ahora sus ganancias son menos por el costo del combustible.
Ha adquirido este préstamo, en Afodenic con el propósito de dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, en comprar  4 llantas, para seguir trabajando en condiciones buenas y buen servicio. El cual está contento ya que no tenía todo el capital para esta compra y que pagara en plazos accesible.
texts.en:
Don Pedro is 46 years old, married and the father of two children who are 17- and 18-year-old students.  His wife is a seamstress and nowadays Pedro has his own business, a route in a small minibus that acts as a school bus.

Initially, he worked in agriculture on his parents' land.  Years later he began to work as a private chauffeur.  Then, he inherited from his father a part of the land which he sold and bought the minibus and that, up to today, has been his means to help his family get ahead, although now his earnings are less because of the cost of fuel.

He has acquired this loan from Afodenic with the purpose of maintaining his vehicle by buying four tires in order for it to continue working in good condition and in good service.  He is happy for this since he didn’t have all of the capital for this purchase and he will pay in affordable installments.

loans.use: to buy four tires in order to continue providing a good service in school transportation.

loans.name: Duo Semillas De Esperanza Group

texts.es: Dúo Semillas de Esperanza , este grupo está integrado por Lidia Oneida Ella tiene 22 años de edad  es casada y  tiene una hija pequeña,  nos cuenta que se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos a mano desde ya hace varios años, desde que inició su elaboración de fajas los vende a un buen precio a otras personas que salen a vender a otros pueblos, y es así como ella está luchando con su negocito, ahora ella nos está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materia prima para la confección de tejidos típicos (fajas) y también desea comprar su producto por mayor ya que por su compra por mayor le dan su material a un buen precio, su sueño más grande es aumentar sus ventas y de esa manera ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Dúo Semillas de Esperanza (Two Seeds of Hope) is a group to which Lidia Oneida belongs. She is 22 years old, married and has a young daughter. She says that she has produced hand-made woven goods for several years. Since she started making belts she has been selling them at a good price to others who take them to sell in various towns. Thus, she is struggling to establish her little business.

Currently, Lidia is requesting a loan to purchase the basic materials to make her traditional woven goods (belts) and she also wants to purchase these products wholesale because by buying wholesale they give her the material at a good price.

Her biggest dream is to increase her sales and thereby help her family.

loans.use: to purchase the basic material to make traditional woven goods (belts).

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang is 34 years old and a resident of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She happily lives there with her spouse and a teenage kid attending a local school. Eang aims to send her child to a college after he graduates from high school. This encourages Eng to work harder for her child’s education. 

Eang recently is in the business of rice farming and fishing as the main source of income for the family. Eang has been in this type of business for over 11 years. At present, she would like to borrow some funds to add to her savings to purchase a plot of farmland to increase her land and produce more output. She hopes that her business will grow and thus boost her profit to cope with the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland

loans.name: Lito

texts.en: Lito, a married father of three young children, lives in Bohol, Philippines where he has been a fisherman for five years now. Lito is requesting a loan of  8000PHP to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his fishing boat in order to increase his catch and income. He dreams of expanding his business so that he can send his children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and fuel for his fishing boat.

loans.name: Charisse Ann

texts.en:
Charisse Ann, a 27-year-old married mother of four young children, lives in Bohol, Philippines where she has operated a candle-making business for more than five years now. This is the source of the family's income.

Charisse Ann is requesting a loan for 8000PHP to buy additional materials for candle making to help her expand the enterprise. She hopes to earn greater income in order to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for candle-making.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is a married woman from Bien Unido, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in the fishing business for a long time now. Since all their five children are grown, they need to look after themselves. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fishing net, fish hooks, and gasoline, which are important in their livelihood. The loan will serve as additional capital so she can further sustain her fishing business and meet the basic needs like food and savings for future use. 

In the future, she would like to improve their livelihood by having another boat for fishing which will generate a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fish hooks, and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy work tools.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is from the community of Bien Unido, Bohol. She is married with one child, aged four years old. 

Dorina and her husband have been into the fishing business for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy lead weights, fish hooks, and gasoline needed for their business. 

Dorina is hopeful that, with their loan and hard work, she will be able to send her child to school and give her a better future. Her profit will be used for family daily consumption, savings, and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy lead weights, fish hooks, and gasoline.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is 24 years old from Trinidad, Bohol. She is married with 2 children ages 2 and 4. She is engaged in a food vending business as well as selling fresh fish in her neighborhood. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients needed for her barbecue like soy sauce, catsup, cooking oil, vinegar, and more fresh fish to sell. She is motivated to work hard for the future of her children. Her profit will be used for the healthy diet of her family and reinvestment in the same business. In the future, she would like to have a bigger and more stable businesses for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients needed for her barbecue like soy sauce, catsup, cooking oil, vinegar, and more fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Fatimah

texts.en:
Fatimah is a 51 year old divorcee and a mother of 8 children. She lives with her kids in Wehdat. Being a committed and loving mother, Fatimah has been supporting her children and wants to get a loan so she can start her own business which is all about catering and making homemade food in quantity. 

She has applied for this loan to get more food containers and increase her productivity by employing more women from the neighborhood who want to help their families.

loans.use: to get more food containers.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a married woman and a mother of two children. She works with her husband together in producing cleaning materials in their own small shop. They have been serving their own neighborhood and city very well. 

They wish to get a loan to produce more of the cleaning products to expand their market to include other cities, as the husband owns a car.

loans.use: to produce more of the cleaning products.

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona is a conservative woman and she preferred that her son appear in the photo instead. 

Mona is a 51-year-old divorced mother. Her son has just finished high school. His mother wishes to help him go to university to study Hospitality Management. She hopes and wishes to help him through his master’s degree as well so she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her son's educational fees.

loans.name: Ibtisam

texts.en:
Ibtisam is a 45-year-old mother of five. She lives with her husband and children in Salt. 

She works from her own home in embroidery and sells her products to her family, friends, and neighbors. She wishes to get a loan to start her own little shop and sell to a larger number of people.

loans.use: to start her own little shop.

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a young artist who started her own project at home in Marka. Being such a good artist, she participated in lots of exhibitions. 

She wishes to get the loan so she can buy more raw materials and get to produce more art and participate in more exhibitions.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials for her artwork.

loans.name: Jose Vidal

texts.es:
Don José sigue laborando en soldadura, su esposa vendiendo comida para seguir con el mejoramiento de la vivienda, sus hijos cuatro casados y dos soltero, uno trabaja y la menor estudia la secundaria. Anteriormente don José era conductor de cabezales y por motivo de bajo salario, renuncio, y comenzo a trabajar con soldadura que aprendió desde joven.
Para él la mejora  a su casa es su prioridad, que ha venido trabajando para el bienestar comun de la familia, hoy con este nuevo financiamiento pondrá cerámica en su sala y levantara un pequeño pantry en la cocina Para una mejor higiene. El cual va por parte para equilibrar sus gastos.
texts.en:
Don José continues to work as a welder and his wife to sell food, so they can continue improving their dwelling. Four of his children are married and two are single. One of the latter works and the youngest one attends secondary school. 

Previously Don José was a semi-truck driver but because the salary was so low, he quit and began working with welding, which he learned to do when he was young.

For him, his priority is home improvement, which he has undertaken for his family’s well-being. Today, with this new funding, he will be able to install ceramic tile in his living room and he will build a small pantry in the kitchen for better hygiene. The loan will help him meet his expenses.

loans.use: to purchase ceramic tile, blocks, sand, cement and iron to build a small pantry.

loans.name: Dúo Acatenango Group

texts.es: Dúo Acatenango. Este dúo está integrado por la señora Eloísa de 26 años de edad, doña Eloísa se dedica a la  venta de productos comestibles aunque no tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a esta actividad ella ha podido aumentar la visita de sus clientes, ya que por su amabilidad conque ella atiende en su negocio la buscan muy seguido, ella está solicitando este crédito ya que necesita comprar más variedad en productos comestibles como(jabón arroz frijol y más,) que todavía ella no tiene en su negocio, espera que kava le pueda ayudar con el crédito solicitado ya que en estos momentos es cuando ella más necesita de su apoyo para levantar más su negocio en ventas.
texts.en:
Dúo Acatenango. Eloísa, age 26, is a member of this duo.  She sells food products.  Even though she has not been doing this for very long, she has been able to increase her customers’ visits.  Because she tends to her business very kindly, the customers seek her out often.

She is requesting this loan because she needs to buy a variety of grocery products like soap, rice, beans, and more.  These are things that she still does not have in her business.  She hopes that Kiva is able to help her with the requested loan.  Now is when she most needs your support to increase the sales in her business.

loans.use: to buy basic needs grocery products like soap, rice, beans, and more.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Jose Luis de 36 años, casado y con 3 hijos, cuenta con una antigüedad de más de 12 años dedicándose a los trabajos de soldadura, en lo cual ya cuenta con una experiencia de más de 12 años, ya que su papa se dedicaba a lo mismo y eso influyo en él para iniciar su propio negocio, el cual ha conservado hasta la actualidad gracias a la calidad con la que realiza los trabajos. El cuenta con casa propia y en horas libres se dedica a realizar trabajos de mecánica, su esposa es ama de casa y lo ayuda atender a los clientes con mucha amabilidad. El Sr. Jose Luis solicita crédito para compra de material para la entrega de un pedido grande de uno de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 36 years old, is married, and has three children. 

He has been working in welding for more than 12 years. He has more than 12 years of experience because his father used to work in the same and that influenced him to start his own business. He has kept the business until today thanks to the quality with which the work is performed. He has his own house and dedicates his spare time to do mechanical works. His wife is a housewife and helps him to serve customers with great kindness. 

Jose Luis is applying for a loan in order to buy material to deliver a large order from one of his customers.

loans.use: to buy material

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa es una persona emprendedora, dedicada a su negocio propio venta de cosméticos en su casa de habitación desde hace mas de 8 años. Actualmente vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo.
Doña Rosa el préstamo lo invertirá en el negocio en la compra de lociones, cremas, desodorantes, y aretes. Doña Rosa espera crecer más con el negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
Los sueños de Doña Rosa en poco tiempo tener una tienda más grande y así tener mejores ingresos y darles a sus hijos una buena educación y mandarlos a la universidad.
Choluteca, Honduras - Julio del 2012
texts.en:
Rosa is an entrepreneur, dedicated to her own business of selling cosmetics in her home for over eight years. She currently lives with her five children and her husband. 

Rosa will invest her loan in buying lotions, creams, deodorants, and earrings for her business. Rosa hopes to grow the business and meet the needs of her customers. Rosa dreams in having a larger store soon and thus higher incomes. 

She wants to give a good education to her children and send them to college.

loans.use: to buy lotions, creams, deodorants, and earrings for her business

loans.name: Kafilath Adouni

texts.fr: Divorcée et mère deux enfants scolarisés dont le plus âgé a 12 ans et le moins âgé a 06 ans, Kafilath Adouni vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques dans une boutique depuis 08 ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés de la place. Soucieuse de renforcer son fonds de roulement et d'élargir son activité, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Finadev en vue de satisfaire les exigences de ses clients et de maximiser son intérêt. Le gain généré lui permettra de payer la scolarité de ses enfants et de fournir des soins médicaux pour son père qui est malade.
texts.en:
Divorced and mother to two children who are in school, of whom the oldest is 12 and the youngest 6 years old, Kafilath Adouni has been selling hair extensions and cosmetics in a boutique for 8 years. She gets her supplies in one of the markets of her area. 

Wanting to strengthen her working capital and to expand her business, she has requested and obtained financial support from Finadev in order to satisfy the demands of her clients and to maximize her interest. 

The generated gains will allow her to pay for her children's school fees and to provide medical care for her father who is ill.

loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions, 1 box of gel and 2 cartons of creams of all kinds.

loans.name: Martha Janneth

texts.es:
La Joven Martha, se dedica a su negocio de Venta de Ropa Nueva y usada, carteras y cosméticos, desde hace un año que empezó, ya que un familiar de ella  le envía la mercadería de los Estados Unidos y la otra la compra en varias tiendas de la ciudad, ofreciéndole variedad y calidad a sus clientes que en su mayoría son vecinas de la colonia donde vive y compañeras de trabajo ya que durante la tarde ella labora para una empresa distribuidora de calzado, ubicado en un centro comercial de la ciudad, a Martha siempre le gusto el negocio ya que desde pequeña su mama ha sido comerciante y le gusta mucho esta actividad.
Martha esta solicitando crédito por la cantidad de L. 10,000.00 para invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de ropa para niño, zapatos de segunda, licuadoras, vajillas y otros, Ella espera que PRISMA le pueda apoyar ya que necesita surtir su negocio.
Tegucigalpa, Honduras – Julio 2012
texts.en:
Young Martha has been selling new and used clothing, bags and cosmetics for the past year. A relative of hers sends her merchandise from the United States and the rest she buys in various stores in the city. Thus she offers variety and quality to her customers, who are mainly neighbors in the suburb where she lives or her co-workers since, during the afternoons, she works for a shoe distributing business located in the city’s commercial center.

Martha has always liked business because her mother was a merchant when she was a child, and she greatly enjoys this work.

Martha is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 lempira to invest in her business by purchasing children’s clothing, second-hand shoes, blenders, tableware and other items. She hopes PRISMA can help her because she needs to stock her business.

Tegucigalpa, Honduras – July, 2012

loans.use: to buy children's clothing, second-hand shoes, blenders, tableware and other items for her business.

loans.name: Tuzamurane / Mshsh Group

texts.fr:
Théoneste Léo fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane /Mshsh. Le nom du groupe signifie «s’entretenir financièrement». Il a 31 ans, il est marie avec 2 enfant de 2 ans à 4 ans. Il a 1 personne en charge autre que ses enfants. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de secondaire.
Théoneste Léo est agriculteur des tomates. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter 50kgs des fertilisants et payer la main d’œuvre.
Pour faire croitre son agriculture des tomates, il planifie d’utiliser des semences sélectionner de bonne qualité pour augmenter la grande quantité pour satisfaire le marche. Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait devenir un grand distributeur des tomates. Avec les profits, il prévoit de payer le frais scolaire et construire une belle maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Théoneste Léo is part of the Tuzamurane /Mshsh group. The name of the group means "to support oneself financially." He is 31 years old, he is married with 2 children from 2 to 4 years old. He has 1 dependent other than his children. His level of education is 3 years of secondary school.

Théoneste Léo is a tomato farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He is going to use his loan in order to buy 50 kgs of fertilizers and to pay for manual labor. 

To grow his tomato farming, he plans to use select good quality seeds to increase the large quantity to satisfy the market. In the coming years, he would like to become a great distributor of tomatoes. With the profits, he plans to pay for school fees and build a beautiful house for his family.

loans.use: to buy 50 kgs of fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: José Elenilson

texts.es:
José tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica al comercio de productos para el hogar, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre quien le enseño desde que era un niño y él lo ha venido desempeñando durante todo estos años. Vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos quienes les ayudan a preparar la mercadería que él lleva a comercializar en toda la zona donde reside.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar más mercadería: cacerolas, ollas, cocinas, licuadoras, hamacas, entre otros electrodomésticos, debido a que la demanda es alta y no puede cubrirla con la mercadería que tiene disponible. De esta manera él obtendrá mejores ingresos, satisfacera a sus clientes y podrá ampliar su negocio. Él desea adquirir un vehiculo de transporte, para ir a vender a otras zonas que visita a pie o en bus y esto le resulta más difícil y le consume mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Jose is 37 years old, is married, and has three children. He sells household products. He learned this trade from his father, who taught him since he was a child, and he has been selling during all these years.
