Chhun would like to help one of her sons improve his living standard by encouraging him to attend a vocational course of auto repair, so that he will be able improve his skills and can improve his income later. At the present time, Chhun has requested credit from HKL and Kiva to pay for her son’s vocational training course. She would appreciate it if she could obtain this loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s vocational training course.

loans.name: Rafatou

texts.fr: Âgé de 29ans, madame Rafatou est mariée à un mécanicien auto. Elle n’a pas encore d’enfants. Elle est commerçante et vend des pagnes et bazins à toutes personnes dans une boutique. Son approvisionnement se fait à Lomé chez les grossistes de pagnes et bazins. Son souhait est de satisfaire les clients à chaque demande et elle manque de fonds pour s’approvisionner en marchandises. C’est une ancienne cliente de notre institution et elle opère le quatrième crédit chez nous. Avec ce montant, elle va s’acheter des pagnes et bazins pour pouvoir atteindre son objectif : la satisfaction des clients. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait rendre son activité pérenne et permettre à sa famille de s’épanouir. Notons qu’elle est dans ce domaine il y a 08ans.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rafatou, age 29, is married to a car mechanic. She doesn't have children yet. She's a merchant and sells pagnes (colorful African cloth) and bazin cloth to a diverse clientele in a shop.

She gets her supplies in Lomé from wholesalers of pagnes and bazin cloth. She wishes to satisfy her customers' every demand, and she lacks funds to get supplies.

She's a long-time client of Kiva's partner, WAGES, who is seeking her fourth loan. With this loan, she will buy pagnes and bazin cloth in order to reach her goal: satisfy her customers.

In the future, she would like to ensure her business is sustainable and enable her family to blossom. It should be noted that she's been in this field of business for eight years.

loans.use: to buy pagnes (colorful African cloth) and bazin cloth

loans.name: Luz María

texts.es: Luz María y su esposo Jacinto se dedican a producir café desde hace más de 17 años y junto con sus 2 hijos se reparten las diversas actividades que tienen que realizar en sus fincas. Además de trabajar en el campo Luz María se encarga de las labores del hogar. La comunidad en la que viven no cuenta con servicios y cuando enferman tienen que viajar hasta otra comunidad en donde si hay una clínica. A pesar de las dificultades han logrado salir adelante y durante la última cosecha tuvieron una producción total de 8 toneladas, las cuales fueron entregadas a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para su procesamiento y exportación. Para la siguiente cosecha necesitan realizar varias labores en su finca como son sembrar nuevas plantas, abonar, limpiar y preparar el terreno. Por esta razón Luz María necesita de un crédito. Además cuentan con un terreno que compraron hace poco tiempo y el cual quieren utilizarlo para producción de café. Además del café también se dedican a producir caña para tener así mejores ingresos para la familia. Luz María nos platicó que en la casa que vive es propia y quiere hacerle mejoras pues tiene techo de lámina y quieren ponerle losa para mayor seguridad y comodidad.
texts.en:
Luz María and her husband Jacinto have been coffee producers for over 17 years. They work with their two children, sharing the different tasks that need to be carried out on their plantation. As well as working the land, Luz María is also responsible for running their home. The family lives in an area which doesn’t have certain basic services, so if anyone falls ill they have to travel to the next town where there is a clinic. 

In spite of these difficulties, the family has managed to get ahead. During the most recent harvest their total production was 8 tons, which they passed on to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” for processing and exportation. For the next harvest they need to carry out various jobs on the plantation such as sowing new crops, fertilising, cleaning and preparing the ground. Luz María needs a loan to be able to do this. 

The family also bought a new plot of land recently, which they would like to use for growing more coffee. As well as coffee, they also grow sugar cane to increase their income. 

Luz María has told us that they own their own house and would like to make some improvements to it. It has a tin roof, which they would like to replace with concrete to make the house more secure and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertiliser for her plantation.

loans.name: Kossi

texts.fr: Revendeur de friperies dans un marché de la ville de Lomé, Kossi est père d’ 01 enfant de 02ans et marié à une tresseuse. Il exerce seul son activité depuis 2008. Mr Kossi est à son premier crédit de WAGES et cela lui servira à acheter plus de marchandises. Il veut assurer la prospérité de l’activité et l’épanouissement de la famille.
texts.en: A retailer of second hand clothing at a market in the town of Lomé, Kossi is the father of a 2-year-old child and is married to a hair braider. He has run his one-man business since 2008. This is his first loan from WAGES and it will be used to buy more merchandise. He would like to ensure that his business is successful and that his family flourishes.

loans.use: to buy second hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Sahadatou

texts.fr: Ayant pour mari un employé dans une société de la place,  Mme Sahadatou âgée de 46ans et mère de 02 enfants. L’ainé a 16ans et le dernier 14ans. Elle est revendeuse de profession et vend des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile et au marché. Son second crédit qu’elle sollicite dans notre institution lui servira à acheter des produits d’alimentation générale (riz, huile végétale, sucre, spaghetti) à Lomé. Elle voudrait devenir grossiste et aider sa famille à mieux s’épanouir.  Il y a de cela 09ans qu’elle est dans cette activité.
texts.en:
Sahadatou is 46 years old and the mother of 2 children, aged 14 and 16. She is married to an employee of a local company. She is a retailer and sells grocery products door-to-door and at the market. This is the second loan that she is requesting from our organisation and it will be use to buy grocery products (e.g. rice, vegetable oil, sugar, spaghetti) in Lomé.

Sahadatou would like to become a wholesaler and help her family thrive more.  She has been in her current line of business for 9 years.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is a 49-year-old farmer from the town of Talibon, Bohol. He is married with four children. Together with his wife, they work hard on their farm in order to meet the needs of their family. He is asking for a loan to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and pay for labor in his rice field. 

Edgardo is dreaming of sending all of his children to school as well as renovating his house. A loan will help him boost his livelihood and make his dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy insecticide, fertilizer, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Hontongnon Group

texts.fr: HONTONGNON est un groupe de huit personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Edith Baï (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un certain Hyacinthe. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Edith Baï a fréquenté l’école et s’est arrêté au niveau primaire. Edith Baï vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près d’une vingtaine d’année, Edith Baï vend des plastiques et de la nourriture à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Edith Baï s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin.  C’est la deuxième fois que Edith Baï et les autres membres du groupe HONTONGNON sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité afin de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Le crédit reçu antérieurement a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Hontongnon is a group composed of 8 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Edith Baï (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 44 years old and married to Hyacinthe. The couple have 3 dependent children, who all go to school. Edith Baï went to school but left at primary level. She lives together with her children and husband, and she and her husband both take care of the various household responsibilities.

Edith Baï has been selling plastics products and food from her home and on the street for nearly 20 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the second time that Edith Baï and the other members of the Hontongnon group request financial support from ALIDé, with a view to strengthening their working capital and their businesses, so that they are better able to respond to the demands of their clientèle. The previous loan has been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy plastic items and condiments.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en: Edwin is a hog-raiser, who lives in the village of Villa Concepcion. He is 44 years old and is married with four children. Edwin is thankful because even though he only completed elementary school, he is still able to complete the needs of his family. At this time, Edwin is asking for a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of his hog. Edwin hopes that he can get the amount he requested, to secure the proper growth of his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vaccines for the maintenance of his hog.

loans.name: Houenoussou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe HOUENOUSSOU est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Angèle est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Angèle est âgée de 34 ans et est une veuve. Angèle n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Angèle est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Angèle vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule ses différents besoins et ceux de ses enfants. Pour parvenir aux différents besoins de la famille, Angèle vend depuis six ans de la nourriture (pâte de maïs fermentée accompagnée de sauce) et des chaussures de façon ambulante. Cette activité lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté à ses besoins ainsi qu’à ceux de ses enfants. Angèle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Angèle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe HOUENOUSSOU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Houenoussou group is made up of 4 people who live in the same area. This is the 3rd time that this group requests financial support from ALIDé, in order to raise their business level. The group's representative, Angèle, is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She is 34 years old and a widow. She did not get an education. Angèle is the mother of 4 dependent children who all go to school. She lives alone with her children and takes care of her and her children's needs alone.

In order to be able to satisfy her family's different needs, Angèle has been selling food (fermented corn dough served with sauce) and shoes on the streets for 6 years. This business allows her to meet her and her children's needs without too much difficulty. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. In the quest to satisfy her customers and to increase her turnover and revenue, Angèle is requesting, together with the other members of Houenoussou, a 3rd loan from ALIDé. The first 2 loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy condiments, vegetable oil and corn.

loans.name: Jesusede Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUSEDE est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Kpèdétin Géneviève est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Kpèdétin Géneviève est âgée de 29 ans et vit au Bénin. Kpèdétin Géneviève est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Jean. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Kpèdétin Géneviève vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari, les divers besoins du ménage. Afin de subvenir à ces besoins, Kpèdétin Géneviève mène comme activité depuis dix ans, la vente des poissons dans sa région. Kpèdétin Géneviève s’approvisionne dans une lagune du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Kpèdétin Géneviève sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUSEDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The Jesusede group is made up of four persons who are friends living in the same neighborhood.  This is the first time this group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé in order to increase the level of their activity. 
The group representative whose name is Kpedetin Genevieve has her hand raised on the photo. She is 29 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a fisherman named Jean.
The couple has four children, all of them attend school and are their dependents. Kpèdétin Géneviève lives together with her children and her husband and together they provide for the various needs of the household. To meet her needs, Kpedetin Genevieve has been selling fish in the region for the last 10 years. She gets her supplies from a lagoon in Benin.
With the goal to meet her customers' demand and to increase her turnover and income, Kpedetin Genevieve and the other members of the Jesusede group are requesting a first loan from ALIDé.

loans.use: to purchase fish.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo y su esposa Sebastiana se dedican a la producción de café desde hace 30 años. Él nos comenta que al principio fue muy difícil porque aunque contaban con un terreno y los conocimientos necesarios para llevar a cabo esta actividad no contaban con los recursos suficientes para invertir en su terreno y no había tantas posibilidades de crédito como en la actualidad. Domingo tiene 2 hijos que viven con él y lo ayudan en las labores del campo, además que en ocasiones trabaja para otras personas y de esta manera puede incrementar el ingreso para su familia. Durante la última cosecha tuvo una producción de 10 toneladas y para mantener ese nivel necesita comprar para la próxima cosecha planta de café y fertilizante. Para eso necesita un crédito. Domingo tiene planeado dentro de un año comprar un terreno para poder aumentar de esta forma su producción de café y si todo sale como él espera dentro de 3 años va a estar produciendo un total de 13 toneladas lo que hará que aumente el ingreso familiar. Entre los planes personales que Domingo tiene está el de comprar una camioneta que a su vez también le servirá para transportar café y fertilizantes, así como también quiere hacerle algunas mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Domingo and his wife Sebastiana have been producing coffee for 30 years. Domingo tells us that things were very difficult at the beginning. Although they had a plot of land and the necessary knowledge to grow coffee, they lacked the financial resources to invest in their land. In addition, there weren’t as many opportunities for taking out loans as there are nowadays.  

Domingo has two children who live with him and they help him on the plantation. Sometimes Domingo also works for other people so that he can increase his family’s income. 

During the most recent harvest Domingo’s plantation yielded 10 tons. To maintain this level of production he needs to buy coffee plants and fertiliser for the next harvest. He needs a loan to be able to do this. Domingo also intends to buy a new plot of land within the next year. If everything goes according to plan, he hopes to increase production to 13 tons within 3 years, which will increase his family’s income. Domingo’s personal plans include buying a lorry, which he will use to transport coffee and fertilisers, and carrying out some improvements to his house.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertiliser.

loans.name: Ayisogbe Group

texts.fr: AYISOGBE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Bernadette (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Sosthène. Le couple a trois enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Bernadette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Bernadette vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari, les différentes charges de la maison. Depuis près de dix ans, Bernadette vend des bijoux et des colliers à son domicile. Bernadette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. C’est la troisième fois que Bernadette et les autres membres du groupe AYISOGBE sollicitent l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue de renforcer leur fonds de roulement et leur activité et de mieux répondre aux exigences de leur clientèle. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Ayisogbe group is composed of 3 people whose members live in the same district. The group's representative, Bernadette (whose hand is raised in the picture), is 54 years old and married to a tailor called Sosthène. The couple have 3 children, some of whom go to school and 2 of whom are still dependent on them. Bernadette did not go to school. She lives together with her husband and children and she and her husband both take care of the various household responsibilities.

Bernadette has been selling jewellery and necklaces from her home for nearly 10 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. This is the 3rd time that Bernadette and the other members of Ayisogbe are requesting financial support from ALIDé, in order to strengthen their working capital and their businesses, and to better respond to their customer demands. The loans previously received have all been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy jewellery and necklaces.

loans.name: Adán

texts.es: Adán comenzó hace muchos años en la producción de café trabajando con su abuelo quien tiempo después le regaló un terreno para que pudiera hacerse cargo de su propio café. Adán realiza personalmente todas las tareas necesarias en la finca como son la poda, siembra, abono, chapeos y durante la época de cosecha contrata jornaleros para que lo ayuden ya que el trabajo es demasiado. Adán tuvo una producción durante la última cosecha de 13 toneladas las cuales entregó a la “Unión Regional de Huatusco” para que fueran exportadas. Para la siguiente cosecha el necesita comprar fertilizantes y planta de café pues tiene sembradas 2300 plantas por hectárea y quiere tener 2500 para así aumentar su producción. Esta es la razón por la que está solicitando un crédito. La meta principal de Adán a largo plazo es tener la capacidad de autofinanciarse y sabe que haciendo un buen uso de los créditos que pueda obtener ahora le será posible alcanzar su meta en unos años.
texts.en:
Adán started out in the coffee growing business many years ago. He used to work with his grandfather, who then gave Adán his own plot of land so that he could produce his own coffee. 

Adán carries out all of the jobs on the plantation himself - pruning, sowing seeds, fertilising and weeding. During the harvest season he hires day labourers to help him, since the work is too much for one person. 

During the last harvest Adán’s plantation produced 13 tons of coffee, which he passed on to the “Unión Regional de Huatusco” for exportation. For the next harvest he needs to buy fertiliser and coffee plants. He has 2300 plants per hectare but would like to have 2500 to increase production. This is why he is applying for a loan. Adán’s main objective in the long term is to be able to finance the business himself and he knows that if he makes good use of the loans he is able to obtain now, he will be able to achieve his goal within a few years.

loans.use: to buy coffee plants and fertiliser for his plantation.

loans.name: Brigitte Dedewanou's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe formé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Brigitte Dedewanou, la responsable, âgée de 33 ans, est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé a 08 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. Couturière de formation, elle a un atelier où elle vend aussi de la mercerie depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Le présent financement lui permettra de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants et de subvenir à ses besoins. Brigitte Dedewanou se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
Brigitte Dedewanou's group is made up of two people who are joint guarantors. Brigitte Dedewanou, the leader, is 33 years old and married. She is the mother of 3 children, aged between 2 and 8, two of whom attend school. She trained as a seamstress and has a studio where she has also been selling haberdashery for several years. She gets her supplies at one of Benin's markets and abroad.

Brigitte Dedewanou has requested and received a loan from Finadev, with the aim of strengthening her business and satisfying her customers' needs. Her current loan will enable her to contribute to her children's educational expenses and to meet her own needs.

Brigitte Dedewanou is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy one box of sewing thread, 2 boxes of fasteners and 2 boxes of mixed buttons.

loans.name: Griselda

texts.es: La señora Griselda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora quien tiene un taller de costura el cual comercializa en el mercado. El credito lo invertira en insumos para complir con unos encargos principalmente tela, hilos, seda, aplicaciones...etc.
texts.en: Griselda is a hardworking, enterprising woman who started her own tailoring business. She will invest the loan in sewing supplies so that she can complete her orders. She mainly needs to buy fabric, thread, silk, accessories for appliqué...etc.

loans.use: to invest in fabric and thread.

loans.name: Marta Beatríz

texts.es:
La señora Marta tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella es costurera desde hace cinco años, además elabora pan desde hace seis años. Ambas actividades las aprendió por medio de unas capacitaciones que INSAFORD proporciono a los habitantes de su comunidad. Antes de aprender estos oficios solo se dedicaba a estudiar.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar: 4 arrobas de harina, un quintal de azúcar, huevos, 3 libras de levadura, 10 libras de polvo para hornear, papel corrugado, manteca, colorante, jaleas y para terminar de pagar dos maquinas de coser que compro al crédito. Con la inversión, ella podrá comprar más productos a más bajo costo, obteniendo mejores ganancias, ya que será un ingreso adicional, pues comenta que actualmente no tiene un fondo para elaborar el pan y las maquinas serán de ella en su totalidad. 

Su deseo es instalar un taller de costureria, que le permita proporcionarle una mejor vida a su familia, al mismo tiempo generar empleo para su familia o para algún miembro de la comunidad.
texts.en:
Marta, 31, is married with two children. She has been a seamstress for five years and a baker for six years. She learnt both trades through training programmes in her local community, which were provided by INSAFORD. Before learning these two trades she had done nothing except go to school.

Marta is applying for a loan with Fundación Campo so that she can purchase the following: flour, 500 pounds of sugar, eggs, 3 pounds of yeast, 10 pounds of baking powder, packaging materials, butter, food colouring and jelly. She will also use the loan to pay off two sewing machines that she bought on credit. 

With this investment Marta will be able to buy more products at low prices, thus improving her earnings, since the money she earns from baking will be additional income for her. She says she doesn’t have sufficient funds for making bread at the moment, and the sewing machines will soon belong to her completely. 

Her goal is to set up a tailoring business, which will allow her to provide a better standard of living for her family. At the same time it will provide work for someone in her family or someone in the local community.

loans.use: to purchase baking ingredients (flour, 500 pounds of sugar, eggs, 3 pounds of yeast, 10 pounds of baking powder, packaging materials, butter, food colouring and jelly) and to pay off two sewing machines that she bought on credit.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: doña Rosa María de 26 años de edad ella se dedica a la crianza de animales desde hace 9 años, este es el tercer crédito que solicita y nos cuenta que gracias a Dios le ha ido bien pagando su crédito y criando sus animales doña Rosa agradece a kiva la ayuda brindada ya que ella se ha superado mucho gracias a los créditos que kiva le ha otorgado ya que ha logrado comprar más Cerditos para la crianza y luego venderlos, Doña Rosa se ha esforzado en ser puntual con sus pagos y ha sido muy responsable con los crédito que le han otorgado, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de más cerdos y también para la compra de concentrado de crecimiento y engorde espera que como en otras ocasiones le puedan ayudar.
texts.en:
Rosa María is 26 years old and for nine years she has been working in animal breeding. 

This is the third loan she is asking for. 

She says that thanks to God she has done well repaying (previous) loans and breeding her animals. Rosa María is thankful to Kiva for the help given. This is because she has overcome a lot thanks to the loan that Kiva has provided her with since she was able to buy more young pigs for her breeding and to sell them later. 

Rosa María is making an effort in being on time with her repayments and she has been very responsible with the loan she has received. She is asking for this loan to buy more pigs and feed for her breeding business. She hopes that, as in other occasions before, she will receive help.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed for them

loans.name: Hamdan

texts.en:
Hamdan is a 38-year-old man. He is married and a father to two sons and two daughters. He is employed, but his low salary isn't enough to cover the family's needs. For the past four years, Hamdan has had a grocery store, which has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Hamdan is requesting a USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request, such as rice, sugar, and milk. This will increase sales and increase Hamdan's income.

Hamdan is photographed in his grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase groceries for his store.

loans.name: Lesbia Patricia

texts.es: Doña Lesbia Patricia de 27 años de edad casada y tiene dos hijos, su esposo es piloto de buses desde hace 10 años, sus hijos menores de edad estudian en la primaria, doña Patricia se dedica a la venta de medicina natural y cosméticos desde hace 2 años, ella vende, shampoo, cremas para manos, para el rostro, la medicina natural la empezó a vender ya que su hermana se enfermaba mucho y le recomendaron la medicina y se dio cuenta que si funcionaba y desde entonces vende sus productos, y es muy buscado el producto ya que es reconocido por su efectividad, ahora desea invertir en su negocio y ampliar la variedad del mismo ya que la clientela es mayor cada día.entonces ella quiere comprar mas medecina natural y cosmeticos, Y  asi lograr ayudar también a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y permitir a sus hijos una estabilidad mayor a la que ellos no tuvieron.
texts.en: Lesbia Patricia is 27 years old, she is married and she has two children. Her husband has been working as a bus driver for 10 years and her young children attend primary school. Lesbia has been selling natural medicines and cosmetics for 2 years. She sells shampoo, had creams and face creams. She has started selling natural medicines because of her sister’s continuous illnesses: she was recommended to use this type of medicine, Lesbia realized that they were working and since then she has been selling these products, and many people look for this products because they are acknowledged for their effectiveness. She now wants to invest in her activity and to increase the variety of products she sells, as her customers increase in number on a daily basis. She therefore wants to buy more natural medicines and cosmetics. Through this mean she will also succeed in helping her husband paying for their household expenses and to grant her children a better stability than the one she and her husband could enjoy.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim, who is photographed next to his taxi, is a 43-year-old man.  He is married and a father to two sons and two daughters, aged 2-16 years.  Rasim is employed but the low salary he gets isn't enough to cover his family's cost of living.

For the past four years, Rasim has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project, but also needs more support to cover its costs. Rasim is requesting a $2,000 loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting and purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's capacity to work extra hours and will enable Rasim to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income.

loans.use: To paint and purchase a new engine for his taxi

loans.name: Benita

texts.en: Benita is 47 years old from Tinago, Dauis, Bohol. She is married with six children. Her husband works as the chief cook in one of the hospitals in the city. She helps in raising her family by operating  a sari-sari (variety) store and selling home-cooked snacks like fried bananas. She is asking for a loan to buy soft drinks, hog feed and rice to resell. Her loan will be a big help for her business to thrive. Any profit will provide her family with a healthy diet and will help to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, hog feed and rice

loans.name: Yasser

texts.en:
Yasser is a 22-year-old man who is married with no children yet.

For the past two years, Yasser has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and the only source of income for his family.  Yasser is requesting a $2,000 youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting, licensing and insuring the taxi he drives. This will improve the taxi's condition and enable Yasser to move legally from one area to another, which will improve the family's income.

Yasser is photographed next to his taxi.

loans.use: to paint, insure and license the taxi he drives

loans.name: Nedaa

texts.en: Nedaa is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children. She lives with her family in Madaba and helps her husband with the household by selling cleaning materials and products. She would like to get the loan so she can increase her inventory of products and sell to more people.  This will allow her to help with expenses and enhance her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to increase the number of products she offers

loans.name: Salam

texts.en:
Salam is a conservative young lady, she asked her father to stand in for the photo instead.

Salam is is still living with her parents in Marka. Being such a dependent lady and wanting to help her parents with her expenses, she hopes to get a youth loan so she can increase the quantity and variety of products and improve her father's profits at the family's mini-market.

loans.use: to increase the quantity and variety of products

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 46 years old from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Lydia also supports her child who is eight years old. At present, she works on her rice farm with her husband and also operates a small sari-sari store. She is asking for a loan to buy stock like chips, detergent, toiletries, seasoning, fertilizer and to pay tuition fees. Her livelihood is important to her so she can be a good provider for her family's needs. Her income will be for her family's daily consumption and school fees. Lydia hopes to give her child a better chance in life through education.

loans.use: to buy stock like chips, detergent, toiletries, seasoning, fertilizer, and to pay tuition fees.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is a 49-year-old married woman with five children. Her eldest is 22 years old and her youngest is 10. Sylvia is from Corella, Bohol. For the past five years, she has run a hog-raising business. Sylvia works hard to support her husband to meet the needs of the family, especially for the education of their children. She takes every opportunity to earn a living.

Sylvia is requesting a loan to buy feed for her pigs and additional piglets to raise.  She dreams of expanding her business to generate more income so that she will be able to send her children to school to learn and become educated.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Suhad

texts.en:
Suhad is a mother of four. She lives in Zarqa and works in trading and selling cosmetics and accessories such as bags, make-up, and other items. 

Suhad is requesting a loan to start her own little shop and increase the quantity of products she offers. This will expand her market share so she can increase her profits and provide a better life for her children.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories

loans.name: Samar

texts.en:
Samar is a 43-year-old married woman and the mother of five children. She lives with her family in Marka and owns a small home business which involves tailoring and embroidery. 

Samar is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine and more fabric to expand her business and increase her production and profit.

loans.use: buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Don Héctor de 35 años soltero vive con su madre aun, se dedica a la venta de verduras y las reparte por diferentes rutas  de Guatemala, vende tomate por caja, zanahorias por arroba o bolsas,  brócoli por ciento o docenas, coliflor por docena o ciento, dependiendo de las temporadas ahora vende aguacates por ciento, don Héctor vende de lunes a viernes de 3 de la mañana hasta las dos de la tarde, su clientela es segura ya que el vende productos de calidad a buen precio, también cuando no tiene venta o termina antes de tiempo hace fletes para otras personas que necesitan transportar sus verduras. Ahora  necesita comprar cajas para transportar las verduras, canastos, y comprar verduras por mayor y así lograr un mejor ingreso, su sueño es poder seguir ayudando a su madre y también terminar de arreglar su casa para cuando se case.
texts.en:
Héctor is 35, he is single and he lives with his mother. He sells vegetables, selling them along the different roads of Guatemala. He sells tomatoes by the case, carrots by the “arroba*” or by the bag, broccoli by the hundred or by the dozen, cauliflower by the dozen or by the hundred, and according to the seasons he sells avocados by the hundred. Hector works Mondays top Fridays from 3 am to 2 pm, and his customers buy safely from him, as he sells good quality products at fair prices. When he has no products to sell or when he finishes early he hauls freight for other people who need to have their vegetables transported. He now needs to buy vegetables at wholesale prices, hampers and cases to transport vegetables in order to increase his earnings. He dreams of keeping in helping his mother as well as in finishing fixing his house for when he will get married.

<cite>*Arroba, a unit of weight equal to 25 pounds.</cite>

loans.use: To buy vegetables at wholesale prices, hampers and cases to transport vegetables.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of three. She lives in Madaba with her family and she works in her own home mini-market selling basic products to her friends and neighbors. 

Muna is requesting a loan to purchase more products to serve a larger group of her neighbors and increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: to purchase products to serve a larger group of customers

loans.name: Vicente

texts.en:
Vicente is a 49-year-old farmer who is married with three children. His eldest is 19 and his youngest is 11. Vicente is from Talibon, Bohol. He started farming three years ago and he is now focusing on making the most out of his livelihood. Vicente tries his best to help and support his wife in meeting his family's needs.

Vicente is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and buy rice. His loan will be a great help to prepare his land for his crops and have a robust and abundant harvest. Vicente dreams of expanding his business to earn more for his family. He also wants to give his children a better education and his loan would be a great help to make his plans a reality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pay for labor, and rice

loans.name: Florisa

texts.en:
Florisa is a 35-year-old married woman with two young children, ages one and eight. For the past eight years, she has run a sari-sari (variety) store. Florisa's business provides her family with the income they need for their daily expenses.

Florisa is requesting a loan to buy stocks such as noodles, rice, chips, rice, toiletries, seasons, and clothing for her children. She would like to make sure that she has enough supply of merchandise so her customers will not go to her competitors. Florisa hopes to improve her livelihood and give her children a better future through education.

loans.use: to noodles, rice, chips, toiletries, seasoning, and clothing for her children

loans.name: Luljeta

texts.en:
Luljeta is 40 years old and has four children. The oldest is 18 and the youngest is six. She is married and lives with her family in the central eastern part of Albania where the topography is characterized by rough, rocky terrain due to the presence of huge mountains. Luljeta started a dairy business eight years ago and her husband helps her out in her business because he does not have a job of his own. Her business has been going well.

Luljeta is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner VisionFund Albania to buy one milk cow. She plans to add three more cows to the heard later on to grow and make more profit. This will be her first loan. Luljeta wants to thank all lenders for their kindness and give her word that she will pay back her loan.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Basel

texts.en:
Basel is a 30-year-old single young man. For the past 13 years, he has run a restaurant where he sells sandwiches and traditional Palestinian dishes such as foul and homos. Basel's business is a profitable project and his only source of income. 

Basel is requesting a 3,000 USD youth loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing meat and beans to make his dishes. His loan will increase his sales and satisfy his customers which will positively improve his life. Basel is photographed in his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meat and ingredients to make dishes to sell

loans.name: Rabee

texts.en:
Rabee is a 23-year-old single young man. He is employed and earns a low salary which is not enough to cover his needs and pay to finish his house. Rabee is photographed inside his house.

Rabee is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of painting his house. His loan will improve the condition of his house and provide a suitable home to live in for the future.

loans.use: to paint and improve his house

loans.name: Nidia Jeanneth

texts.es: Para doña Nidia quien tiene en su domicilio una tienda de consumo diario desde hace 7 años,  se siente orgullosa como mujer trabajadora  y madre de  de 4 hijos, aunque sabe que esto representa para  ella una obligación y compromiso muy grande  como también por su negocio ya que a Dios gracias tiene mucha clientela quien la visita desde muy temprano en la compra de los artículos necesario para el sustento diario, también ha incluido en su negocio la venta de recargas y tarjetas electrónicas, todo esto la impulsa a seguir luchando a pesar del alza que ha tenido todos los productos de la canasta básica, por lo que ella necesita de mas capital para seguir comprando y no quedarle mal a su clientela, obteniendo de esta actividad un beneficio para su familia y sentirse como alguien que le brinda apoyo y servicio a su prójimo.es por eso que esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad.
texts.en: Nidia, who has had a small grocery store in her house for 7 years, is proud to be a hardworking woman and mother of 4 chidlren. She knows that they represent is a big responsibility for her, as does her business. She thanks God that she has a lot of customers who visit her starting very early. They buy the items they need for their daily life. She also sells celular minutes and telephone cards. All of this drives her to keep fighting despite the rise of prices in the basic family basket products. That is why she needs more capital to keep buying and not look bad to her customers. With this she will obtain benefits for her family and feel like somone who supports her neighbor. That is why she is asking for thisloan to buy basic necessity food products.

loans.use: to buy basic necessity food products.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 40-year-old married man who has two children. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. Mustafa hold a bachelors degree in law. He used to live in a rented house, but now owns a small house that he wants to complete. 

Mustafa is requesting a 300,000 YER loan from AMB to help cover the costs of purchasing furniture for his house. His loan will ensure him better living conditions. In the future, Mustafa hopes to open a store and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Comfort Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who goes to school. She has had a retail shop for four years now. She works from 6am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use to buy kerosene, wheatflour and other items to sell in her shop. Her dream is to one day be able to start selling chips.

Flora will share this loan with her loan group, Comfort, with 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks such as kerosene and wheatflour for her shop.

loans.name: Al-Rzq Ala Allah Group

texts.en:
The group of women named "Al-rzq Ala Allah" has been in existence for many years. The group consists of four women who enjoy working and participating in their businesses. They are from Sana'a, Yemen. They are all friends and are always cooperative when they work together because they want to help their families. 

They have applied for a loan of 150,000 YER. One of the members is Horiah, who is 37 years old. She is married and has seven children. She and her family live in Sana'a, Yemen. Horiah is a person who is known for being an entrepreneur and a hard worker. She makes brooms for her customers. She has been in this business for five years. Thanks to her hard work, she has been able to help her family. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy building materials for her house.

loans.use: to buy building materials for her house.

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en: Khalid is 42 years old. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking and honest man. He works for a corporation. He has applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Jomah's Group

texts.en:
This group is called Nasr. It consists of seven members who live in Hodeidah, Yemen. The members have developed business activities and applied for a loan of 360,000 YER. 

Aisha is a 33-year-old married woman who has one child. She currently has a business selling ladies' clothes. She learned the trade and has been in this line of work for many years. The loan of 60,000 YER from AMB she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital so she can buy ladies' clothes. These items will eventually be sold from her retail space. Working in this manner allows her to help her family move forward.

loans.use: to buy ladies' clothes for her business.

loans.name: Bianca Maria

texts.es:
Bianca es joven de 26 años de edad, soltera, vive junto a sus padre, no tiene hijos, desde hace seis años inicio un pequeño negocio de venta de cosméticos, perfume y ropa por encargo, iniciando  con dos mil córdobas y dinero propio de ahorro, ya que anterior mente trabajaba en una distribuidora en ventas en el mercado, al salir, comienza a vender por si sola y con ayuda de sus padres.
Hoy en día ah aumentado sus inventarios con las ganancias de sus ventas, captando clientes, estando en mejores condiciones al tener sus propias entradas apoyando a sus padres.
Su casa es sencilla y por tal razón está optando al financiamiento en Afodenic, para poder levantar una pared de concreto, e ir por parte, materiales a comprar: piedra, arena, cemento, hierro para comenzar la obra y poder gozar de mejores condiciones de vivienda y un techo más seguro el cual esta contenta.
texts.en:
Bianca is 26 years old, she is single, she has no children and she lives with her parents. She started a small activity 6 years ago, selling cosmetics, perfumes and clothes by request. She has started with two thousand córdobas, money she had in her own savings from her previous job in a distribution center in the market; when she left that job she started selling on her own and with her parents’ help.

Nowadays she has succeeded in having a better stocked-up inventory thanks to an increase in her sales and by gaining new customers and she is enjoying better living conditions as she has her own income and she can now support her parents.

Hers is a simple house and for this reason she is requesting a loan to Afodenic in order to put up a concrete wall, building it little by little. She will buy stone, sand, cement and iron to start the works and to succeed in enjoying better living conditions in her house, as living under a safer roof will make her happy.

loans.use: To buy stone, sand, cement and iron.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Simona sigue en sus ventas cada día en su pulperia, que gracias al esfuerzo, ahorros, ganancias y financiamientos ha logrado vender una gama de productos en variedad. Se ha dedicado completamente a la pulpería ya que la venta de ropa en los departamentos no le estaba resultando en sus utilidades.
Sus cuatros hijos están casados, está separada de su esposo, una etapa triste en su vida,pero cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y nietos. Lo que seguirá invirtiendo para mas solides ya que tiene que pagar todos sus gastos en agua, luz, alimentación, medicina.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara: seis quintales de arroz, tres quintales azúcar, cinco bidones de aceite, productos lácteos y golosinas. Siendo bien demandados por sus clientes. Para ella es de gran sastifacion este medio de prestamo a plazos, ya que se equilibra en su economia.
texts.en:
Simona is still selling every day in her small grocery store. Thanks to her hard work, savings, earnings and financing, she has been able to sell a range of different products. She has dedicated herself completely to her store, since selling clothes in the departments wasn't resulting in profits.

Her four children are married and she is separated from her husband. This has been a sad time in her life, but she has the support of her children and grandchildren. She will keep investing since she has to pay for all of the expenses of water, electricity, food and medicine.

With this new loan she will buy: six quintales of rice, three quitales of sugar, five cans of oil, dairy products and candies. These are very much in demand from her customers. For her this loan payment plan is very satisfactory, since it balances her finances.

loans.use: to invest in basic grains, dairy products and candies.

loans.name: On

texts.en:
Farming is the most popular business activity for Cambodian people who live in the countryside as well as for many people in some Asian countries. 

On, aged 45, is a married woman who is responsible for four children, in Kompong Cham province. She has many years of experience in farming, so she is confident she can maintain healthy crops and improve her farming practices from year to year. 

On is able to grow and harvest rice crops twice a year and she usually generates a good income to satisfy her living needs. She manages her income wisely and mainly uses it for her children’s education. She will educate them up to a university degree and this is her priority in life. 

On’s husband always assists her in growing the crops and also goes fishing to encourage her in a fish sales business. On would like a loan to support her husband in fishing activities by purchasing new fishing materials. With this precious fund from Kiva leaders, it will help make On’s husband’s business to go well.

loans.use: to purchase new fishing materials for fishing activities.

loans.name: Gbegbe

texts.en:
Gbegbe is 34 years old and lives in Kakata Town. He is married and has two children, ages 5 and 8, who live at home and attend school. 

For the past five years, Gbegbe has been running a shop where he sells many items (e.g. rice, fresh milk, candy, etc.). He is requesting a loan to purchase more inventory for his business. The problem he has faced is the rainy season, which causes business to be slow. He started this business by helping his father to sell.  What he likes about this business is that it has helped him to keep away from problems with friends. The way he exchanges money with others makes him proud. In future, he wants to open another shop.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory for his business.

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es: Maria de jesus, ella tiene 28 años de edad es casada y tiene una niña es dueña de una libreria y su esposo le ayuda con la administracion de su negocio,hace un años su esposo sufrio un accidente muy grave pero cracias a Dios a podido salir adelante, doña Maria tiene una gran bariedad de mercaderia ya que es la unica libreria que esta en su comunidad,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de, cuadernos,resmas de hojas para fotocopias libros,laminasl y articulos de libreria.
texts.en: Maria de Jesus is 28 years old, she is married and she has one daughter. She owns a bookstore and her husband helps her managing the shop. One year ago her husband had a serious accident, but providentially she has succeeded in getting ahead. Maria sells a great variety of products as hers is the only bookstore of her community. She is requesting a loan to buy notebooks, reams of copy paper, books, prints and bookstore items.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, reams of copy paper, books, prints and bookstore items.

loans.name: Mujeres Cumbeñas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Cumbeñas se ha formado hace dos años y medio por 8 socias quienes viven en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, su centro tiene una arquitectura moderna y colonial, es de clima frió. Su gente es amable y gentil, se dedican al comercio, cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos salen a labora en la ciudad o han migrado a otros países para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus  familias, su mayor orgullo es que aun mantienen viva la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, tiene 30 años, es divorciada pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 12 y 3 años de edad, su primera hija  está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre con quien comparte los gastos.

Doña Ana se dedica a las labores de su casa para poder estar al pendiente de sus hijos, para aportar a la economía de su hogar se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y pollos a los que los vende en su comunidad. También es profesional en la rama de la costura y esta actividad la realiza desde su hogar.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 5 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de  pollos y alimento para sus animales. 

Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Cumbeñas communal bank was formed two and a half years ago by 8 members who live in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca. It's downtown has modern and colonial architecture and it's climate is cool. Its people are friendly and kind. They work as merchants, raising animals and in farming. Many of them go to work in the city or have immigrated to other countries to improve their and their family's quality of life. Their biggest pride is that they still keep their people's culture and traditions alive. 

One of the members of this group is Ana. She is 30 years old, divorced and the mother of two children, aged 12 and 3. Her oldest daughter goes to high school in town. She doesn't own her own home and lives in her mother's house and shares expenses with her.

Ana does her housework so she can take care of her children. To support the household she raises guinea pigs, pigs and chickens and sells them in her community. She is also a seamstress and does this activity from her home.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for 5 years and she will investher new loan in buying chickens and feed for her animals. Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed for the animals

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao, age 25, is a pig raiser. She owns a wooden pigpen in her backyard, where she keeps big pigs for breeding and piglets for fattening. She spends her day taking care of her pigs and feeding them. She cleans the pigpen daily to ensure good living conditions for her pigs. She has been in this business since 2007. 

Through her effort and patience, Mao hopes that she will be able to sell her raised pigs for a profit upon maturity. Mao is very happy that she is able to help her husband provide the family with food as well as pay for the education of their child and cover daily costs. 

In this rainy season, Mao’s family is experiencing a challenge due to the rainfall because their roof and walls are too old and decayed. Mao would like to solve her problem so she has turned to HKL for financial help in repairing her present house. She will use this loan to purchase zinc and wall boards to replace the broken ones for her house.

loans.use: to purchase zinc and new wall boards for her house.

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Hem, age 23, is a hardworking woman who generates income by cultivating rice in the Baray district of the Kompong Tom province. She is married to a local farmer and has a lovely young child. This couple is able to make a profit from their business, around KHR 7,600 per person, to support their other financial expenses. 

In order to increase their income, they also weave bamboo baskets for selling, aside from their farming business. Hem would like to have a motorcycle to support her in her weaving business. Her husband can also use it to look for tropical trees, which can be used as raw materials for their weaving business. These trees are located in a faraway, distant area of the province.

Hem would like to take out a loan of KHR 1,000,000 to purchase a motorcycle for both business and home use. This will be her first loan with HKL. Hem hopes that Kiva lenders will not reject her loan.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for both business and home use.

loans.name: Pech

texts.en:
Pech, aged 43, is a resident of Kompong Cham province, where she and her spouse have been growing crops on their fertile farm for over 20 years. 

Together they co-operate well in order to generate an income to cover their daily expenses. They are blessed with four children, two of whom are single and the other two are already married and living in separate houses. 

Pech plans to make more revenue by enlarging her plantation and increasing output. Therefore, Pech has decided to apply for a loan through HKL to purchase a plot of farmland from a local villager.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of farmland from a local villager to expand her current business.

loans.name: Kroy

texts.en:
Kroy is 55 years old and married. Currently, Kroy and her husband are busily employed as paid workers in a local rubber plantation in the Baray district of Kompong Tom. They are able to earn a proper wage per day for use in meeting their family's financial expenses. They have seven children; four are single and also working in a variety of jobs and sharing responsibilities with them, while the remaining three are married. 

As their house is getting old, it needs to be repaired. For many months, Kroy and her family have lived in uncomfortable conditions due to the lack of funds to fix it. In order to solve this problem, Kroy is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase planks of wood to replace her wall and also broken parts.

loans.use: to purchase planks of wood to repair her house.

loans.name: Hout

texts.en:
Hout, age 31, is a humble villager living in the Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is married to a local farmer and has three school-age children who still need daily allowances. Hout and her husband have tried hard in their business in order to uplift their living standard and provide their children with basic necessities. Hout cultivates the land and also raises pigs in her backyard to add more income, while her husband manages a rice farm and is involved in a firewood-trading business. Hout's husband owns a buffalo and a trailer for transporting his firewood place to place. He is the main income provider of the family.

Due to the need of an additional buffalo for the support of the firewood business, Hout would like to obtain a loan in the sum of KHR 4,000,000 to purchase a buffalo. The buffalo also can be used in the farming business. She hopes that the loan will contribute to a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo to help transport firewood.

loans.name: Sath

texts.en:
Sath is a loving mother of two children, age 4 and 15, living with her family in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is 38 years of age and is involved in planting seasonal crops including rice, potatoes, and various types of vegetables. Through doing this, Sath can earn a suitable income each harvesting season. 

Sath's husband helps her in this type of business and also offers a transportation service to people in his neighborhood. Recently, his transportation business has been suffering because of his old motorcycle. It often breaks down while he is operating his service. 

With regard to this, Sath decided to borrow some funds from Kiva lenders in the amount of KHR 3,200,000 to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband's transportation service. Sath believes that the loan will bring financial stability for her family. Sath wants to provide her children good opportunities for education as she strives to work hard.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle for her husband.

loans.name: Jackson Lomeling

texts.en:
Jackson is a  42-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has six children between the ages of 2 and 16. Four of them go to school.

Jackson runs a timber-selling business, and he has been in business for eight years. He has one employee. 

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of  5,000 SDG to purchase timbers and other supplies. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Jackson would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs and poor roads. Jackson says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building material like timbers.

loans.name: Las Minas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas está formado hace dos años y medio, tiempo en la cual han obtenido el grupo cinco créditos, este grupo esta conforman por 10 mujeres quienes viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar de clima frió, tiene una geografía accidentada, tiene varios lugares turísticos para visitar. Su gente al igual que nuestras socias en su mayoría se dedican a la agricultura, cría de animales y al comercio, muchos han migrado a otros países o también salen diariamente a la ciudad de Cuenca para ejercer diferentes empleos, son personas amables y gentiles que luchan el día a día para mejorar su calidad de vida.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Verónica, tiene 19 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa unión ha concebido un hijo quien apenas se encuentra de 6 meses de edad. Su esposo labora en la rama de la construcción como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

La Señora. Verónica por el momento le dedica la mayor parte de su tiempo a su hijo y a su familia, también cría y vende gallinas y cerdos, siembra hortalizas las mismas que las  vende en su comunidad.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con la cría de estos animalitos ya que es un buen negocio.
 
Su meta es construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Las Minas was founded two and a half years ago and in this time the group has obtained five loans. 

The group comprises of 10 women who live around La Parroquia del Valle situated in Cuenca. It is an area with cold climate and a hilly landscape with many tourist attractions to visit. Its people like our loan applicants mostly make a living in agriculture, animal breeding and trade. Many have also migrated to other countries or leave daily for the city of Cuenca to carry out different work there. The people are kind and gentle and fight every day to improve their quality of life. 

One of the loan applicants of this group is Verónica, who is 19 years old and is in a civil union. As a result of this union she has received a child which is just six month old. Her partner works as a mason in the construction industry. They don’t have their own house and so they live with her mother-in-law and share the household expenses. 

Currently, Verónica spends most of her time with her child and her family but she also breeds and sells hens and pigs, and plants vegetables to sell them in her community. 

This is the first loan she is taking out with the communal bank. She will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens to start breeding these small animals because it is a good business. 

Her goal is to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Alejandrina tiene 48 años de edad, es una mujer amable, solidaria, emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Convive, durante muchos años, con Máximo, quien es agricultor, tienen un hijo de 12 años y viven en la casa que pudo forjar como resultado de mucho esfuerzo y continuo trabajo.

La actividad que ella realiza es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad, tiene una bodega instalada en su vivienda, la cual estableció como respuesta a las necesidades económicas por la que frecuentemente atravesaba su familia, ya que con los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba. Ahora cuenta con un ingreso adicional que le genera un alivio económico. Lleva en este negocio recién un año y lo ha visto crecer lentamente con el paso de los días, algunas veces recibe el apoyo de su cónyuge cuando éste tiene tiempo disponible y no se encuentra trabajando en el campo. Le gusta su negocio, pues le permite tener un ingreso adicional con el cual puede apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de permanecer constantemente en su casa y cuidar a su hijo que se encuentra en etapa escolar y al que quiere mucho. 

Este es su tercer préstamo con la institución MFP, por ello agradece el apoyo brindado para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además se siente cómoda dentro de su banco comunal, pues considera que es un grupo cuyos miembros son responsables y solidarios.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1200 nuevos soles, comprará abarrotes en general como arroz, azúcar, huevos, aceites, galletas, leche, productos envasados y otros, a precio por mayor buscando así tener mayores ganancias y surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, age 48, is a kind, supportive, enterprising, and very hard-working woman.  She has lived with Máximo, a farmer, for many years.  They have a 12 year old son.  They live in a house that they were able to build as the result of a lot of effort and continual work.

Her business activity is selling basic needs groceries.  She has a grocery store set up in her house.  She established the store as the answer to the financial needs that the family frequently faced.  She did this because her life partner’s income was not enough.  She now has an additional income that generates financial relief.

She has had the business for just one year.  She has seen it grow slowly as the days pass.  Sometimes Máximo helps when he has time and is not working in the fields.  She likes her business as it allows her to have an additional income to help her life partner with the household expenses.  Also, she can always be at home and take care of her son.  He is school age, and she loves him very much.

This is her third loan with MFP.  She is grateful for the support given so that she is able to realize her plans.  She is comfortable in her communal bank as she feels that the members of the group are responsible and supportive.

She will use the requested 1,200 soles to buy general groceries like rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, cookies, milk, packaged products, and others.  She will buy wholesale as she is looking to get greater income and to stock her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy wholesale general groceries like rice, sugar, eggs, cooking oil, cookies, milk, packaged products, and others..

loans.name: Choun

texts.en:
From Baray district, Choun is a 28-year-old woman who works as a garment factory worker. She receives a formal salary each month. Her husband is chief of a team of construction workers. He is the main income provider for the family and he typically makes around USD10 each day. 

Her husband's business is busy as he gets more orders from existing and new customers because of his good reputation. Recently, Choun’s husband has needed more construction supplies to complete his daily jobs sufficiently. However, due to the lack of capital he can’t afford to buy the materials. Choun, his supportive wife, would like to seek a loan of USD600 for the purchase of construction tools and materials. With this money, Choun strongly believes that she can improve her family's living conditions and satisfy their needs.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools and materials to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Progress Group

texts.en:
Agatha, who is in her early 20s, is single. She has had a  beauty salon business for one year and six months now. She works from 8 a.m. to 9 p.m daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This  will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she wants to use for buying salon equipment. Her dream is to one day be able to build a house.
	
She will share this loan with her loan group, "Progress," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is an industrious farmer who has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. He is 58 years old and married with six children, two of whom are already married and live independently around the province. 

Yan can earn income from three different types of business: rice husbandry, fishing, and also as a paid worker. Yan has worked hard because he desires to meet the needs of living and pursue a good quality of life. Also, Yan consistently supports his children’s education, which will enable them to become professional some day. 

It’s now rainy season in Cambodia and Yan is very busy with his farm work as well as fishing. He has some of his children help him in the two businesses. Due to the shortage of capital for the purchase of a fishing boat and a motor, Yan has applied for a loan through HKL in the amount of KHR 3,000,000. Through this equipment, Yan strongly figures that he can earn a good profit in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and a motor.

loans.name: Kibosho Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 20s, is single with one child who goes to school. 

She has had a beauty salon business for one year now. She works from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to buy cosmetics and to pay household expenses, and she has paid  her loan successfully.

She wants a loan to buy more cosmetics and a dryer. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group "Kibosho," whose 16 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and a dryer.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
Amalia tiene 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y decidida, con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Convive, desde hace 18 años, con Carlos, quien trabaja como taxista, fruto de esa unión tienen cinco hijos de 18, 16, 9 ,7 y 2 años de edad. Vive junto a toda su familia en su casa propia, la que tienen como resultado de mucho trabajo y años de ahorro. 

Ella ha instalado una tienda en un pequeño espacio en su casa, desde hace 6 meses, donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, pan, leche, huevos y otros accesorios de utilidad. Atiende solo durante todo el día y ha visto que la rentabilidad de este negocio es muy gratificante ya que le ha servido para solventar muchos gastos que antes le generan intranquilidad. Le gusta ese negocio, pues no le exige realizar esfuerzo alguno y trabaja tranquilamente en la comodidad de su hogar, además le permite tener ciertos periodos libres que los dedica a realizar las actividades que demanda su familia y atender a sus hijos. Está obteniendo muy buenas ganancias y eso la impulsa a seguir adelante por lo que ahora pretende expandir su local e implementarlo con productos y artículos de ferretería como una opción más de compra para sus clientes.

Este es su segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, le va bien en su grupo, ya que todos son responsables y cuando hay algunas dificultades siempre encuentran solución. Se compromete a  seguir siendo responsable con el pago puntual de sus cuotas, como lo fue en el préstamo anterior. Además manifiesta estar muy agradecida con la institución por el financiamiento recibido.
Con el monto solicitado, de 1000 nuevos soles, comprará madera y clavos que necesita para ampliar su tienda, así mismo comprará algunos artículos de ferretería para complementar la venta en su tienda como clavos, cables de electricidad y focos.
texts.en:
Amalia is 38 years old. She is a hard working, earnest and determined woman with many desires to get ahead. For 18 years, she has lived with Carlos who works as a taxi driver. A result of this union are five children who are 18,16, 9, 7, and two years old. She lives alongside all of her family in her own house, which she owns as a result of much work and years of saving.

She has installed a shop in a small space in her house six months ago where she offers all types of basic products like rice, sugar, bread, milk, eggs, and other useful accessories. She attends it only during the day and has seen that the profitability of this business is very gratifying since it has served her to pay many expenses that before created stress. She likes this business since it requires no effort and she works peacefully in the comfort of her house. Additionally, it allows her to have certain free time that she dedicates to performing the work that her family demands and tending to her children. She is obtaining very good earnings and this encourages her to keep going since now she wants to expand her shop and stock it with hardware products and articles, as one more option for purchase for her customers.

This is her second loan with MFP. It is going well in her group since all are responsible and when there is any difficulty they always find a solution. She promises to keep being responsible with her repayments, as she did with her previous loan. Also, she shows that she is very happy with the institution for the loan received. With the amount requested, 1000 new "soles" she will buy wood and nails that she needs to expand her shop. Also she will buy some hardware items to supplement sales in her shop like nails, electrical cables and spotlights.

loans.use:
to buy wood and nails needed to expand her store, as well as to buy some hardware items to supplement her sales in her store like nails, electric cables and spotlights.

Comprará madera y clavos que necesita para ampliar su tienda, así mismo comprará algunos artículos de ferretería para complementar la venta en su tienda como clavos, cables de electricidad y focos

loans.name: Juma Charles

texts.en:
Juma is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has five children between the ages of 2 and 12. Three of them go to school.

Juma runs a poles-selling business, and he has been in business for nine years. He has one employee. 

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the loan officers. He is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase poles and other materials. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In 5 years Juma would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs and poor roads. Juma says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through the help of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building materials like poles.

loans.name: Dennis

texts.en:
Dennis is a 36-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the ages of four and nine, all of whom go to school.

Dennis has run a timber-selling business for seven years. He has one employee. He has no other source of income. His major challenges include high transportation costs and poor roads.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 5000 Sudanese Pounds (SDG) to purchase timber and other building materials. 

In five years Dennis would like to expand his business and open other branches. He says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as timber.

loans.name: Charity Jendia

texts.en:
Jendia  is a 32-year-old  businessman  who lives in Juba. He is married and has 3 children between the ages of 3  and 8. All of them go to school.

Jendia  runs a brick selling business, and has been in this business for 5 years. He has one  employee. He heard about Finance Sudan through  advertising by the officers. He is taking a loan of  5000 sdg to purchase bricks and many other items.  In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In 5 years Jendia  would like to expand his  business and open other  branches. His  major challenges include high  transportation costs. Jendia  says he is happy about the loans given by Finance Sudan  through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy materials like bricks.

loans.name: Edward Ladu

texts.en:
Ladu is a 35-year-old businessman who lives in Juba. He is married and has three children between the age of 4 and 10. All of them go to school.

Ladu runs a poles-selling business and has been in business for five years. He has no employees.

He heard about Finance Sudan through promotions by the officers. He is taking a loan of 5,000 SDG to purchase poles and other items. In addition to this business, he has no other source of income.

In five years, Ladu would like to expand his business and open other branches. His major challenges include high transportation costs. Ladu says he is happy for the loans given by Finance Sudan.

loans.use: to buy building materials like poles.

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Roeun is a 32-year-old married woman who has been residing in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She married her spouse, a good business partner, and has four children who currently are attending local schools. Roeun is a proud entrepreneur who has been engaged in the farming business for over ten years, growing various kinds of seasonal crops including rice and potatoes. From this, she is able to yield a suitable income of KHR 10,400 per day.

Roeun aspires to improve her farming project and maintain high production through the year. For this reason, Roeun turned to HKL for the second time to take out a loan of KHR 1,500,000 to cover labor costs incurred in planting rice and working on her potato plantation. Through her hardships and effort, Roeun hopes to attain a better quality of life someday.

loans.use: to pay labor costs for planting rice and working on her potato plantation.

loans.name: Hor

texts.en:
Hor is 30 years of age and married with an only child. She is currently living in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is in the business of planting and harvesting rice, beans, and vegetables each crop season. She works at the field along with her helpful husband and together, they are able to generate approximately KHR 20,400 per day. Hor has been in this since 2000. 

Due to insufficient funds, Hor would like to acquire a loan from HKL and Kiva to rent a tractor to till the land and to purchase bean seeds for growing. She hopes to have a fruitful harvest in the upcoming season and that she can better her living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a tractor to till the land and to purchase bean seeds to grow.
